Reviews.Title: “Great NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BPreston310
Reviews.Content: This was a random, last minute booking for a work trip. We usually stay at the Marriott in Times Square for their corporate rate, but got sick of the circus. Times Square is great if you have never been to NYC, but gets really old after awhile. So, we picked this spot and were pleasantly surprised. It was in a great neighborhood and easy to find. The ground floor lobby provides convenient check in and then you head up to the second level. This is the fun part of the hotel. The concierge lounge and Opia Restaurant are located here. There is an affiliation with the hotel, but Opia is run separate. Great food and great bar scene in your hotel. Would recommend making a stop before or after dinner for a drink. You need to change elevators to get to the guest rooms, which is a little awkward but not that big of a deal. This is NYC, so you can expect a smaller than usual room that is clean and nicely appointed. I believe this used to be another hotel property and went through the Marriott conversion. The hotel was priced very reasonable for NYC and plan on staying here again. Staff very friendly and same goes for the Opia team. Make sure to say hello to Bella at the hostess desk at Opia.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for 1st x NY trip”
Reviews.Author: clarissaloves2travel
Reviews.Content: My husband had never been to NY before, where as my family is from there and i had been many times. Our trip was gonna be taking us to the Bronx, queens, and Manhattan so this location was perfect because after seeing family in the different burrows we came "home" to all the touristy stuff for him to see. (time square, empire state building, central park, apple store, etc etc,) WE could even go get drinks and pizza without worrying about staying out too late. The hotel is SO clean, the reception people where SO nice and prompt. check in was almost too easy! the bar lounge looked great (even though we didnt spend a lot of time in it). The hotel is RIGHT next to (and above) great shopping. Kenneth Cole is on first floor/next door of the building! Bathrooms and bedrooms are small, BUT it is new york, and they use the space so well! My husband is built like a football player and he felt comfortable in the room (when we were there and not sigh seeing)

Reviews.Title: “Fourth time here - I really like it”
Reviews.Author: lotsotripsneedsleep
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here four times and find it to be my hotel of choice in mid-town. The rooms are comfortable for one or two and the service is excellent. The rooms are quiet and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Really wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: yehudag
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful night away at the Renaissance New York Hotel 57. The staff was very warm from the second we walked in. The offered us water bottles to drink while we checked in. The staff were there for us the whole time. When we we arrived in our room we realized there was a problem with the air conditioner. Maintanence was there in under a minute. The kind fellow fiddled with the unit for a minute or two when he declared it broken. He than personally escorted us to our new room down the hall carrying our bags for us. They were so nice and proffessional about that we didn't even feel the inconveniance. The concierge was especially helpful with helping us with our evening and morning plans. The room was small but extremly comfortable and up to date. Very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Avant garde”
Reviews.Author: brownman6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a remodeled older building with a modern style public areas and minimalist decor in the rooms. The rooms are small but not closet sized and clever use has been made of the space but more drawer space is a need. The bath is marble lined with clever cubby holes for towels etc. Elite customers have a nice lounge and the breakfast and evening food and beverage items are well prepared and displayed. The staff is friendly and I thought the exercise facility state of the art.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and cozy”
Reviews.Author: baytownbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on a brief trip to NYC at a very good price. The hotel is extremely well-located at 57 and Lex. The staff is friendly and helpful. They loaned us an umbrella on a rainy day and helped us get away early on the last morning. It has a "boutique" feel. Our "cozy" room included breakfast. The breakfast was mediocre. The room was very small (about 100 square feet). But we could not beat the price and location. We were on the fourth floor but had no problems with sleep becuase of the room fan.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyTravels
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, upscale & artistic decor, beautiful bathroom with stone accents, interesting lobby. We had a corner room overlooking 57th, which was terrific, albeit a bit noisy. Everyone on the staff from Larry the Manager who greeted us when we arrived to the bellhops were friendly and welcoming. Good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Thats all folks!”
Reviews.Author: Mightymarkflemnj
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott only guy, that is my reference point. Great staff, they really try to be A+. NYC rooms are small, these rooms are super small. Bed was awful, prison mattress, shower had no pressure and the bathrooms were just plain goofy. There are much better choices in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BiniTravels
Reviews.Content: We originally booked the cozy room but asked for an upgrade during check in which we luckily got. The upgraded room was large for a NYC hotel room and the bathroom was large too! The location is great. It's away from the major tourist spots, yet only a little walk away. We will definitely return to this hotel when we are back in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: kroywen1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at the Renaissance NY Hotel 57 in New York City. It was a terrific experience in every way. Elizabeth B., Guest Services, was especially welcoming and helpful, together with the rest of the staff. The hotel is conveniently located on 57th Street and Lexington Avenue near the best shopping, restaurants and activities in NYC. It is operated like the best boutique hotel, with furnishings and decor to match. The restaurant Opia on premises even has a jazz combo at night. As they weren't serving breakfast in the Executive Lounge on weekends, they gave us complimentary vouchers for full breakfast in the restaurant! Unexpected and a A++ touch. This will definitely be our go-to hotel whenever we are in Manhattan, usually 2-3 times per year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NYC Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: s r
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYC many times before and have stayed at many different hotels, but the price, location, and service at 57 cannot be beat! Service: the hotel decor is extremely modern and trendy. Based on the "trendiness" of the hotel lobby, you would expect the staff to be uptight and arrogant; however, the exact opposite is true. The staff were extremely accommodating and sweet. The trip was a surprise for my wife and the staff at check in gave us a room with a great view. Minutes after check in, they even brought by complimentary goodies to the room since the trip was a special occasion. Room: the rooms are a little tight, but you can't expect much more in NYC. The bathrooms are spacious and everything is extremely clean and modern. Location: can't beat it, everything you want is within walking distance....go on google maps and check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Noel S
Reviews.Content: Having read a number of quite critical reviews on this hotel, I was expecting to be disappointed. I was not at all. Check in was handled in probably under three minutes! Polite, efficiency was how I would rate all the staff my wife and i interacted with. The hotel is small and the "cosy room" was just fine for the now night we spent there. The bathroom was full sized and the bed super comfortable. We live in upstate New York and have stayed in a few hotels in NYC so do not have unrealistic expectations as regards hotel room size. Free and delicious snacks were available i the bar area. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “well run property in great location”
Reviews.Author: HVB
Reviews.Content: See your room first. When I arrived, the first room we were given was extremely small with a horrendous view. I immediately called the front desk and complained. The manager showed me to a very nice and much bigger room that was perfect. We did NOT book the smallest room and my husband is an elite marriott member so I was disappointed at first but the hotel recovered quickly. The hotel is very nicely decorated, tasteful and hip without being over the top obnoxious. It was quiet and peaceful. The breakfast area was especially lovely. The concierge had many good recommendations and excellent advice. The rooms were quiet despite facing the busy street. The cocktails at the bar were strong and well performed. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful room, a really nice time.”
Reviews.Author: WellesleyDriver
Reviews.Content: I was surprised when I booked this property at such an affordable rate. But then, January is usually a bargain. We like midtown east, being close to the park and so many fun restaurants. This weekend it was Tosca at the Met. The staff was friendly, from the doorman to the maids. Our deluxe queen was not big, but the natural wood, comfy bed and fine linens made for a very luxurious feel. Two windows with double drapes made for a good nights sleep, even with the occasional city sound peeking in. A very nice, highly styled bathroom with a deep tub puts the finishing touch on this classy, but comfortable room. With a million other hotels to choose from, I'm still coming here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: lys1234
Reviews.Content: Upscale hotel in great neighborhood. I have stayed several times and found the staff to be friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, beautiful design.”
Reviews.Author: mike47TelAviv_Israel
Reviews.Content: Spent just one night here, but would have happily stayed for more. Terrific midtown location in the middle of great shopping and museums, without the hubbub of Times Square. The friendliest hotel staff around and beautiful design touches everywhere -- especially in the warm lobby with its Chihouly-style lamps and unique fireplace. The room wasn't big, but was certainly comfortable. Can't opine regarding price, as someone else picked up the bill, but I'm told it was super-reasonable (about $200 a night). I would definitely choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “it was right under our noses and we still couldn't find it!”
Reviews.Author: marian s
Reviews.Content: This upscale Marriott property has two remarkable things going for it. First, it's REALLY obscure in its location. There are no door men outside to take your bags or large marquee announcing its presence right off Lexington Avenue. We literally were standing on the door mat that said "Renaissance" on it and were completely lost until we noticed a small sign saying "Opia" and I remembered that was its restaurant. But its presence isn't the only thing that's understated. Attention to detail is remarkable,too. When I requested its turn down service in the evening, I was very surprised to find that in addition to the customary chocolates left by the pillows, the staff had judged ( correctly) which was the female side of the bed and had placed on my side a packet of makeup remover towelettes. For morning breakfast, I was pleased with a gleaming and very hot pot of good coffee but when I went to add milk from the small ceramic pitcher I was amazed that it was actually hot. Very lovely. I don't know if the price we paid for a decent queen sized bedroom with an oversized bath ( $152) is a long-lived special promotion or if it will disappear when this place catches on but this is really an outstanding value in a hard to please town.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, cozy retreat in the middle of the hectic city!”
Reviews.Author: Shirala23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2010, again in December 2011, and have reservations for January 2012. We LOVE it here. The rooms are clean, spacious (for NYC standards) and modern. Love all of the glass art work in the lobby and the incredible glass fireplace. All of the staff were friendly and attentive. The gym was a great added bonus after indulging in the best foods NYC has to offer! What I loved the best was the warm, dark, cozy feeling you got when you walked into the hotel which helps in rekindling any romance! Would recommend this hotel to anyone! Also, this hotel is ideally located two avenues from all of the best shopping on 5th avenue. Definitely take advantage of it!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy decor, excellent staff, noisy HVAC”
Reviews.Author: SearchLite99
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel on 57th near Lexington and Park Avenues is really convenient to many venues and great dining. We found the staff to be very helpful and they responded quickly to our needs. Our room was a junior suite located on a building corner that had lots of windows which provided interesting views. The room is a little larger than others that I have stayed in and has a nice layout with places to sit and work. The decor throughout the hotel is trendy and unusual. The fireplace in the lobby is amazing and provides a centerpiece for lounging, enjoying free snacks and having a drink. Opia Restaurant and Bar is a bit expensive for our tastes but that doesn't keep people from filling it every night. Its clearly a hip and popular spot in the neighborhood. Unfortunately, trendy decor isn't always functional. The raised ceramic bowl in the bathroom is awkward and takes away from much needed counter space. On the other hand, the shower is one of the best I've seen in a hotel. We found the heating and air conditioning system to be slow to respond in getting the temperature right. That means it runs often and is very loud when it does. We didn't sleep well as a result. Other reviews mentioned traffic noise from 57th Avenue but we didn't find that as offensive as the HVAC system. The lighting in the room is a little cheap for a Renaissance. Many of the lamps didn't work properly. This could be fixed for a modest investment given the success of this hotel. While your at it, add another mirror in the main room. Complaints aside, we'll definitely come back to this hotel as it has much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ellen J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here New year eve- prepaid for the room booking via Priceline. Paid A LOT for this closet size room but were treated like we had been given it for free. At check-in and out, were referred to as a 'via 3rd party' guest. HUH?? Really cause this hole in the wall room given to us for 3 people cost over $400 for the night. Arriving back from Times Square, we were stopped at the entry to the restaurant, told no food was being served unless we had purchased the party package, even though just 20 minutes earlier I called to ensure food was available otherwise we would have eaten before we returned. The very snotty maitre d' 'allowed' me to purchase a cocktail and drinks for my kids but then I needed to 'move on' . Horrible experience, rude service, ridiculously small room. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for New York under 300!”
Reviews.Author: Mattsaab
Reviews.Content: Finally a very good boutique hotel in a great location that is warm, genuine, comfy and cool. The Renaissance 57 is the perfect budget boutique hotel that actually delivers style and quality without feeling like a rat in a trendy, cheaply executed cage. (FYI-- many boutique hotels in new York are truly terrible and claustrophobic. This one isn't. The rooms are small. But they are nicely decoarated with great lighting, great beds, large tvs and bathrooms with just enough design to delight. The only bad thing in the room are the ac units under the window-- they are louder that anyone would like, but they can be turned off for sleeping. The rooms in no way are soundproof. If that is an issue, don't stay here. The lobby staff and bellman are friendly and the service is top notch! Very genuine and very not New York. The concierge is however, friendly but not a real concierge. They try, but their recommendations are few and faulty. The location can't be beat for those looking for a real New York experience, far from the Las Vegas lights of Times Square. Bloomingdales is around the corner, Park Ave businesses are steps away and the upper east side is at your doorstep. If your budget needs to be watched, take a look at this property and I'm sure you'll be surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great value!”
Reviews.Author: googleyb
Reviews.Content: Just got back this morning (jet lag kicking in so excuse spelling mistakes) and had a really nice stay in this hotel for 4 nights. Concierge and Doorman very polite and helpful. The Receptionists are a bit frosty but you only have to deal with them once when checking in. One of the Concierge guys was called Joey and he was REALLY polite, helpful and knew the area well. It was never a problem for him to give us directions or advice. Room was not as big as you'd normally get for the price but it is in the middle on Manhatton. Size worked well though - well set out to make use of space. Room was very clean and the bed was easily the most comfy we've ever stayed in. Nice big TV too with lots of channels. Iron and ironing board also available in the room. Hotel is in a great location - close to Central Park, a Subway line and it's walkable to broadway (20mins). Taxi to Broadway is about $6-8. Central Park can be walked to in 5 - 10 minutes. Lots of great shops on 57th and within a couple of minutes walk - Apple, Bloomingdales, A&F, Nike Town etc. Overall a very decent hotel and we will stay again. Only minor gripe is the bottle of water in the room for $7.... They're $1.5 in the pharmacy just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: tarilyn
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to NY for a few days to celebrate her 16th birthday. Our first night we stayed here and then we were transferring over to Times Square. Before we checked out, we were very sad to leave this hotel, as everyone was so helpful and friendly. It almost felt like home! We talked with Joey, the concierge/navigator, for quite a while and ended up knowing mutual friends in Louisiana-small world! He recommended places to eat and places to see. He also send up a box of birthday chocolates with a hand written note for her while we were out that night! The room is small but very nice. Plenty of closet space but little drawer space.The bed is plush and very comfortable. Great view and very little noise could be heard from down below. Joey told us that it was once an all women's residence back in the day, and when it was taken over by the hotel, the rooms became smaller to add a bathroom in each one. But the room, bathroom, lobby, and the hotel itself is very modern, clean and lovely. We even called from The Met to say we were running late and needed a late check-out(normal time is 12) and they gave us the option to check out whenever we needed. I reallly appreciated that as we no longer felt hurried.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night in the City!”
Reviews.Author: ellen080
Reviews.Content: Just before Christmas, my husband and I decided to tak a day to shop and be "tourists" in the City, do the tree, windows, etc., and really make a day of it by staying overnight in the city. We chose the Resaissance New York Hotel 57 and we could not be more pleased! First, drive up and valet parking! A real treat in New York and at $55 a bargain, to have your car taken away and brought back the next day--ideal! Every single person we encountered at the hotel was polite, professional and just plain nice from the charming and informative Doorman to the smiling Receptionest. We asked for extra towels and had them in minutes. The room was spacious and a great value, the bathroom was large and really beautiful, there was abundant storage space in the room, really perfect for a longer stay. But the best part was the bed/bedding! Scrumtious, cozy, sparkling white, crisp bedding! The bed was so amazing! Honestly, no one can beat the Marriott chains for incredible bedding. The buffet breakfast in the morning was excellent. For out of town people it is also a perfect location--close to many attractions and near all transportation. All in all, a really great stay and a great value in NYC!! Hats off to the GM, who seems to have this place humming. By the way, when you are there don't forget to stroll over to P.J. Clarke's for a brew and a burger, that is a real New York experience and it really topped off our day, we even brought the dooman back a burger! Great day, great hotel, highly reccommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a boutique hotel, not a chain”
Reviews.Author: GateE10
Reviews.Content: Interesting lobby and common spaces, comfortable rooms (especially the luxury suites), and a good in-hotel restaurant. Located at 57th and Lex, so is in more of a "business" part of town (Midtown) than a tourist location, but it is only a short walk to Central Park and Rockefeller Center, and it is very close to several subway lines. It's expensive because it is New York City, but no more than the basic/standard room you would find at a Marriott or a Hilton, so you get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “The Check In attendant, bell hop, and housekeeping are a wonderful crew.”
Reviews.Author: jb645
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this hotel with my hubby. Location was the main reason why we stay here, followed by a reasonable rate. We stayed over a Christmas weekend. The Check in attendant and the bell hop greeted us very warmly. Check in process went very smoothly. We received a king bed corner room on the 11th floor. Room is a definite small side but nonetheless very cozy and boutique dÃ©cor. The issue that I had was bumping into the corners of bed and shelves as I moved around the room because of the small space of the room. Aveda bath supplies are a nice touch. On my first visit, we got the superior king room and it was a bit more spacious but closets were the middle dividers of the room between bed and bathroom. Having the closets in the middle of the room did not make sense in the design concept. Overall, it was a comfortable stay both times. We bumped into our maid outside our room and she was friendly. We had breakfast in the Opia restaurant, which was included in our stay. The service and food were great. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable, comfortable stay at a cool hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Juvenives
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stated at Hotel 57 more than two years ago. At that time the hotel was finishing up some refurbishing. We took along our daughter who was almost 2 at the time. Maybe traveling with a toddler to NYC was not the brightest idea but it was fun. When we arrived, the staff greeted us warmly and they were quite friendly. It was our first trip to NYC together and were pretty unfamiliar with the area. They graciously switched us to a larger room on a nicer floor for no extra charge after my husband petitioned nicely. They gave us several vouchers for free breakfast at their restaurant/lounge...I think we only paid for breakfast once in the five days that we were there. The room was spacious enough with a great view of the street. Every morning my daughter would wake up and sit on the window ledge looking at the cabs passing by. I would recommend this hotel based on the service, cleanliness, location and the price. NOTE: I TRAVELLED IN 2009 ON MEMORIAL DAY WEEKEND NOT IN 2011.

Reviews.Title: “THE GOOD AND THE SUGGESTIONS”
Reviews.Author: lglvr
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for 2 reasons. Location and Marriott affiliated. Stayed one night to do the holiday thing with the kids. We are frequent visitors to NYC. We are from LI so know a lot about the city and try different places to stay depending on location. Wanted to be close to the tree so this seemed the perfect pick. THE GOOD: STAFF WAS JUST LOVELY. SO HELPFUL. SO FRIENDLY. CAN'T SAY ENOUGH NICE THINGS ABOUT THEM...THANK YOU! The restaurant on site "Opia", although independent of hotel (I believe) was great. Food was excellent and atmosphere was wonderful! Rooms were clean and efficient. You didn't need or want for anything. Beds were comfy. :) Flat screen TV. Plenty of storage space. Location was close to everything. Quick walk to many major attractions. THE SUGGESTIONS I am not one to complain too much, especially b/c I am so loyal to Marriott, but instead of giving the negatives, I will give a few suggestions. 1. Ask for a room that is not ON 57th Street. The traffic noise was pretty bad and made for a rough night sleep. But we managed. :) 2. Skip the comp breakfast or go super early. The room they host the breakfast in, although nice and clean and warm, is beyond small for the amount of people, who like us, are late risers and rush to breakfast before it ends, lol. You can eat comfortably in the Opia restaurant if you want to pay for a nice breakfast. 3. Check-out is a busy time and the wait for the elevators can be a little long. Small elevators so they fill up quick. Just be patient. :) Other than that, this was a nice hotel with an exceptional staff. Thanks for a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: rfk2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few weeks ago for 2 nights. No complaints. Very friendly staff. Got to NY early and room was ready by noon. Nice corner room on 14th floor looking north up Lexington. King bed with plenty of additional space for 2. Didn't feel cramped at all. Enjoyed the breakfasts in the lounge. Sirens / traffic can be noisy but it's NYC. Quick walk to Central Park, 5th Ave. Walked back from theater district one night and didn't seem that far. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: GraceDyese
Reviews.Content: I have leaved in New York so I know the city quite well. However, it was great to stay in that area as it at walking distance from shopping, restaurants and metros. The rooms are a little small but great quality.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: SeaviewKing15
Reviews.Content: Cons: Small room Small bed (double or full). Small for tall people Furniture in need of repair in our room No coffee maker in room ($3 in restaurant) No doorman to help me get a cab in the rain Small elevators that are shared with cleaning personell. Many stops Pros Good location, midtown east and near Central Park South Attractive lobby and public spaces Comfortable mattress Decent view from 13th floor Restaurant on premises (only used for coffee) Efficient use of space in small rooms Nice bathrooms with Aveda bath amenities

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay Review - Consistently Great!”
Reviews.Author: cpirrotta
Reviews.Content: 4-5 star hotels can sometimes be a bit stuffy or snobby...this is not the case with the Renaissance 57. On our first visit, we stayed for two nights and brought our 8 month old daughter. They could not have been more accommodating. Besides checking us in at 10am, well before the standard time, they gave us a room upgrade for free to have more space for our daughter. Top that off with a representative coming to our room with a baby gift basket that included a beanie tyÂ® elephant and we were well on our way to fully enjoying our visit. The only 'downside' of the room was the bed - it was pretty well used and just didn't have the firmness one would expect from a quality mattress. On our second stay just recently we did not bring our daughter and still got the same level of service and quality. However, this time, the bed was much better. The staff, especially the concierge are top notch. We highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Quick One Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: MisterPatel
Reviews.Content: In town for business with a vendor. Location is dependent on where you need to get to, Approx 10-20 minute walk to Times Square depending on your pace. Quirky entrance as you don't check-in where you walk into building, have to go one level up to check-in. Typical Manhattan Hotel room, not big at all but nice. Has a boutique vibe, more dark lighting type atmosphere. Price was way too high but company paid. I wouldn't pay it on my personal dime considering no breakfast or internet included in the rate. Had issue with turning on shower, could have been me though. Didn't order room service. In general, nothing overtly bad or overtly great.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Manhattan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nhtigercat
Reviews.Content: I was treated to a stay at this hotel and it was so nice. Its a boutique hotel. Had a lot of cool displays. Glass chandeliers in unique shapes. A really interesting glass tube fireplace. The lounge Opia attached to the hotel had delicious appetizers and drinks. The room though small was very nicely decorated and the staff was ever so helpful when asked about restaurants to visit late night in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not Really a Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PA_Family-Travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was close to a college my daughter was visiting. The hotel is very nice, up-scale, kinda artisy. However, not many families stay here. Unless you really like the location, you should look for another hotel if you are bring the family to the City.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but poor management!”
Reviews.Author: wehave3
Reviews.Content: We love the location of this hotel as well as it's cleanliness. It is a boutique hotel so there isn't a lot of room but that's ok with us. The problem we had was when we went to plug in our iPhone charger into the lamp outlet. A huge spark shot out and started a small fire. My husbands hand was burned and our charger ruined. We had people come up to the room and found a live wire that was coming out of the clock. After all of this no one on the staff asked us about needing medical attention or anything else. We thought they would at least offer to move us to another room since our room was filled with smoke. I'm just disappointed by the handling of this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Marshastirrat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rebaissance 57 the two nights leading up to Thanksgiving. From the moment we entered the property every member of the staff treated us as special guests. We were upgraded to a room on the 17th floor which had a gorgeous rooftop terrace attached. The room was well appointed and extremely comfortable. The maid freshened our room at least twice a day and left goodies for us each night. We received a beautiful tray of cheeses and a bottle of wine the first evening as a gift from the manager, since we were in New York to celebrate my 50th Birthday! The location was fabulous and the concierge staff gave us recommendations for restaurants and activities that were exactly what we were looking for. The second night of our stay we had some issues with noisy guests next door and upon check out we were notified that night would be complemintary. If you want a fabulous place to call home in New York City and be treated as an honored guest, this is the spot. I can't stress enough how incredible the staff, location and ambience were. I will definitely be back as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAFF, GREAT LOCATION, FUNKY HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamDenise
Reviews.Content: Just got back to the UK after a 7 night transatlantic crossing over to New York on the Queen Mary 2, then a couple of nights at the Renaissance. I didn't really know quite what to expect, after reading the mixed reviews on here. Our taxi driver found the hotel easily, it's on a very busy crossroads of 57th Street and Lexington. The building is a mix of modern and older parts and the entrance is situated between a couple of shops and is quite discrete. The concierge on the lower lobby was helpful (we had quite a few questions for him during our stay and he printed addresses off for us, as well as checking telephone numbers), and the hotel reception is on the first floor. The reception is very quirky with amazing chairs and lighting, and is different from the usual Renaissance/Marriott hotels. There are two bars and a restaurant off the reception, all in all quite small and intimate, not a big hotel chain feel at all. We were given a room upgrade due to being Gold Elite members, and the room was lovely. A huge bed, gorgeous bedding and lots of pillows, masses of wardrobe and cupboard space. A huge flat screen tv and a very spacious, modern bathroom with a huge selection of Aveda toiletries. Within minutes of arriving in the room, we answered a knock at the door and there was a present of a bottle of wine and a huge box of chocolates, as they had noticed it was my birthday when checking the passports. What a nice touch. After a quick freshen up we went down and had a drink in the Opia bar, which was buzzing with lunch time clientele, all looking very smart. It had a great New York feel about it. You pay for the priviledge though, by the time the 20% tip had been added, 4 beers were $39! Looking for something quick to eat after journey, there's a TGI Fridays within 50 yards, so we headed there, for standard TGI nosh. Immediately surrounding the hotel there are lots and lots of shops, restaurants to suit all budgets, news kiosks, street food vendors, snadwich/salad bars etc etc, and constant traffic. Two doors down there is a standard New York diner, called the Palace Restaurant and we had a traditional American breakfast here both mornings at a good price. We found it virtually impossible to get a taxi early on Friday night, and the concierge spent 15 minutes to hail one down for us. He was fantastic. Would we stay at this hotel again? - Without a doubt!!! The staff and management were some of the friendliest yet professional and helpful I have ever encountered. A testimony that you don't need to be stuffy to be professional. Oh I wish we were there now. p.s. The outdoor bar/terrace area is closed in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lisa D
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 girlfriends stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in September. Although the room was a little "cosy" we were very comfortable and are good enough friends that this wasn't a problem. Good size bathroom and enough closet space for 3 women! The location is great for midtown and just a block away from Central Park. Staff were really friendly and obliging, most notably Joey the concierge who recommended and booked a brunch venue for us and arranged for us to receive a complimentatry glass of champagne when we arrived! I wouldn't choose the B&B option as there is a great diner downstairs from the hotel with every kind of breakfast you could possibly want on offer for a very reasonable price. No sign of bed bugs either. Would definitely recommend and will hopefully return myself!

Reviews.Title: “Keep your expectations set right on this one”
Reviews.Author: JohntheLast
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very pleasant staff, concerned that you've enjoyed your stay but the hotel rooms need a revamp. Modern but a bit run down. Breakfast was very good. Only downside was that they made a big deal about doing double points and amenities if you were a platinum member and then they didn't deliver anything at all. Just a minor miss but not expected at this type of hotel. Probably better value for the money but it is very well located.

Reviews.Title: “cool spot near central park”
Reviews.Author: Liorfi
Reviews.Content: this is a very cool place to spend your nights in NYC, however, the rooms are very very small, the bed is usually small, 140X190. but the bath is great, cleaned every day and very furnished. i think they had a new makeup for them so the rooms look new. there is a LCD screen in each room and the housekeeping is very efficient. if you book with priceline you will probably get the smallest room, it is about 14-18 Sq\m which is very small for a couple with 3 suitcases. they have a nice bar in the looby, but prices are very expensive. you can have starbucks downstairs. the hotel location is its main advantage, it is located in front of Victoria secret, old navy , daffys and right above the 50st subway station. try to get a good deal in price line and it will be a great plce to be in NY. i wont reccomand you to be there if you are a family,,,

Reviews.Title: “The staff made the difference”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaTravelor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed often at Renaissance properties. For New York, this is an excellent location. I have stayed at the other Renaissance EastSide location so this was new for me.This is a boutique hotel but had some surprisingly nice services, such as a feather free floor (for allergy prone). The staff were very helpful - a surprise in NYC. I got really accurate restaurant suggestions, suggestions for what to see, what to avoid, and a friendliness unusual for New York (I've stayed in NYC many, many times - this staff was truly helpful.) Go for a high floor to avoid noise (it's NYC). Hotel had a nice breakfast area and rooftop lounge. Surprisingly good restaurant, especially since there are so many good restaurants in the area. When it came right down to it, it was the staff. Especially good was the concierge service - if I needed a cab, I got a cab; if I needed a certain kind of restaurant, the recommendation was spot on; if I came back in, the concierge asked me how it was. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “A real let down”
Reviews.Author: i-live-for-lunch
Reviews.Content: It is surprising that this property is still part of the Renaissance chain. It is very run down; It probably tried to be fashionable 15 years ago. The wall to wall carpeting and heavy wood paneling are a dead give away. Unfortunately it is also poorly maintained, and very dirty. Its the kind of place here you fear touching anything, because there are grime marks everywhere and it all feels terribly ikky. Breakfast arrived late, with half the items missing. The fact that one of the lifts would stop forever on the 9th floor is deemed as normal here. So is the fact that there are no minibars in the rooms, or that you cant even walk round your bed without bumping into the furniture, because the rooms are so small and the furniture so big! The internet is so slow that my office email programme said "replication terminated because of excessive time receiving response". If only it had known that I had been charged $19 for internet access, it would have tried harder. The staff is woefully unhelpful - obviously quite used to an endless stream of complaints. There are plenty of hotels in NY at this price point, the W, Crowne Plazas et al. Go there, not here. This place should be put out of its misery, and the manager fired.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great!”
Reviews.Author: panajoe81
Reviews.Content: Good Boutique Hotel, definitely have stayed in much better Renaissance. Stayed on a junior suite and was good size, nothing too fancy, more like a Marriott than a Renaissance. The lobby is much more boutique than the rooms! Great Shower Heads! thats a big plus for me! the concierge lounge was pretty good for breakfast! Very friendly staff! good hotel to stay if you get a good deal, if not there are better places to stay in the city!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jack35216
Reviews.Content: perfect hotel for business. located one block from the express subway. rooms are spacious for new york and designed with ample desk and closet space. bathroom is sleek and modern. nice bar and restaurant. new favorite boutique hotel in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Average Service”
Reviews.Author: AllanMCCosta
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Close to everything, subway one block away. Reasonable rooms (quite dated, yet confortable), but average service. A bit on the slow and careless side. Better hotels for the same price in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but TINY boutique hotel; great staff!”
Reviews.Author: fusfus77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are both elite Marriott members and decided to cash in some points for a trip to NYC. We opted to stay at Hotel 57, as we loved the look and vibe of the place from photos we saw online, plus the location couldn't be beat (5 blocks from Central Park). We were very pleasantly surprised when we stepped into the lobby to see the unique, chic decor - very beautifully and stylishly designed! Unfortunately, the main check-in area is so small, that only two desks are available for check-in. At the time we arrived, only one desk was open and there was a line of half a dozen people - not very efficient... I must pause here and also state we brought out 4-month old son with us, as we couldn't get a sitter for the weekend. We were concerned about bringing him to NYC, as it isn't the most "baby friendly" place. We were again pleasantly surprised at how friendly everyone in the hotel was towards us and our little boy. The hotel made accomodations for us to have a roll-away crib and a mini-fridge since I am a nursing mom. Back to the hotel itself... After we got checked in, we went up to our room on the top floor and were very UNpleasantly surprised to find out how TINY the room was - it could not have been any larger than a large walk-in closet. And a crib most certainly would not have fit. We called down to the front desk and after finally speaking with the manager, they made arrangements to switch rooms for us (THANK YOU TO MANAGER LARRY!). The hotel also gave us coupons for free breakfast each morning and the restaurant (Opia) was a nice morning experience. The dining room got crowded, so service was slow and not always attentive, but we weren't in a rush either (and they were very kind about us bringing in a baby stroller). All in all, I give this place 4 stars. It's a beautiful little boutique hotel, but it is tiny in every regard - from the lobby, to the elevators, to the rooms. The staff was great to us, especially Cliff the maintenance guy who delivered the baby crib and mini-fridge, despite the confusing room changes. The location truly cannot be beat if you want to be near Central Park and all the great shopping Madison Ave has to offer. This was a very cool Marriott property - thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, central, beautiful hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Alan_Swiss_1971
Reviews.Content: I stayed by Renaissance 57 many times, and in this neighborhood is the one I prefer: the style is unique, staff is really friendly and helpful when problems arise, and is the perfect location to start visiting Manhattan, near the main undergrounds and 5 mins walk from Central Park. Rooms are not big compared to other hotels in the neighborhood (Fitz, Loews, Parker Meridian), but I find them warm and complete. Gym is OK, and the lounge bar named Opia is stylish and wellknown by New Yorkers. Breakfast buffet is tiny but complete.

Reviews.Title: “Worked great for us!”
Reviews.Author: likesabitofluxury
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms here for a night in the City. Rooms were great. Sleek, comfortable, small, but plenty all that was needed. Loved the lobbies and the general design of the hotel. Location can't be beat either. Best of all, the staff was super nice, pleasant, and always ready to be helpful (although we actually didn't ask for much, it seemed that way...)

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigAlMaggie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years back it is in a Fab location in NY the hotel was clean staff friendly when leaving the front desk ordered a limo there is a fab little Diner just along from the hotel brill breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Interesting- Mixed Feelings about this one”
Reviews.Author: MTCB
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique type hotel but it still carries the Renaissance brand. Room was small and had some clear cigarette burn marks on the wood surface next to the window and on bedside table.... not what I would have expected in a hotel of this caliber. Overall room needs a good do-over (paint, varnish and some scrubbing). Location cannot be beat and even with issues is still better than many other NYC properties. Price was right compared to other hotels in vicinity but still feel this place needs a good clean and renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Bloomingdales and opia omelet â€“ all incl”
Reviews.Author: venefica
Reviews.Content: I really appreciate the location of Renaissance 57 â€“ Lexington avenue which is close to everything, Bloomberg office and Bloomingdales are just around the corner. Opia restaurant (lobby level) serves perfect breakfasts â€“ omelet is a piece of art. Generally the hotel is ok. It is not as outdated as many other hotels of that category. However it really depends on the room you stay in. Our first choice was a classic double â€“ really small, very old and with such a noisy air conditioner that it was literally impossible to sleep. The next morning weâ€™ve got an upgrade to superior which was nice (photo attached), although aircon still not the quietest one. Our story with the hotel was the laundry case. We wanted 3 polos to be cleaned the next morning, however something went wrong, and on our leaving day they were still not done. The receptionist was very nice taking care of everything and the hotel mailed us the cleaned clothes free of charge to Miami. It was a pity though that after the laundry all 3 polos were ruined (small twice the size). Be careful with that. All and all, middle impression of the stay. Would consider coming back because of the location, but will be choosing the room carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel around”
Reviews.Author: twocapemay
Reviews.Content: Now, taking into consideration this hotel calls itself a boutique hotel (small rooms, few amenities) it's probably one of the best in it's type I've ever stayed in. The rooms are small but have every amenity you need (minus bathroom hooks). They are styled perfectly and very clean. Surprisingly, lots of storage space and a very elegant bathroom. The staff was superb!!!! Everyone from the bellhops to the waiters in the quaint bar to the conceriege, made it a point to say hello and ask if they could be of any assistance. Easy to check-in and the valet parking was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting.....”
Reviews.Author: Farzana770
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property a few times. Interesting, to say the least. The guest rooms are incredibly small and very noisy from the street traffic. The location is great, but if you have to work in your room -- it would be quite difficult. The bar/restaurant are good. Service was very attentive and the balcony seating is a nice touch for a NY hotel.

Reviews.Title: “extra luggage from other guests seems to be a pattern”
Reviews.Author: davidt4
Reviews.Content: stayed at the renaissance over labor day weekend for two nights. staff was very nice . the last day we left our luggage with the valet so we could tour the city. when we picked up the car from the valet they were kind enough to load the luggage into our car. surprise , when we got home we noticed they gave us an additional bag from another guest. reading the other reviews it seems like this is a common occurence. when we found out we had the extra bag we immediately called the hotel as we were sure there was a hotel guest that probably was quite upset and worried. the hotel simply said "thanks" and said they would send us a prepaid fedex label to send it back. they wanted us to go get a box . i advised them they should send a box and they eventually agreed. we have sent the extra bag back and have never heard back with even a thank you. while the staff is nice, confused management is being to polite. this property needs a new gm. its a pity

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and found the room and beds comfortable. The location was great as you felt you left the crowded Manhattan streets behind you. It's surrounded by good family friendly restaurants, shops, a handy drug store and the beautiful Sutton Place area. But the real star is Joey the concierge, who did his utmost to make our trip as enjoyable as possible, from maps to printing off boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, but nothing extra”
Reviews.Author: gringosanti
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on a short layover visit to NYC in the end of August. Good things: great air conditioning, comfy bed, nice TV, very nice bathroom and shower, plenty of room to stow baggage and stuff even though the room is small. With no breakfast or really any other services besides checking you in and out, the hotel is just a really nice place to sleep. And it is really nice, with a good aesthetic. The staff was the real star of the stay though. Very friendly, very welcoming, always pleasant and smiling. They held out bags for us after we checked out (we had a night flight and explored the city all afternoon). One of our bags was taken by another guest by accident, but they got on it right away, and drove it out to us at the airport well before we even finished checking in. These things happen, and the hotel staff handled it very very well, so thank you guys.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Kermie9
Reviews.Content: The hotel, after a distinct renovation of the interior decor, tries to draw in the boutique hotel types. After looking a little closer it's evident that it draws in families and vacationers that are seeking good value- low prices, clean and modern rooms. It is a bit faded however. If you wonder into the stairwell you can see that behind the scenes was not upgraded. But the rooms were decent. Location good. We bid for it on Priceline. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel but great location and helpful staff.....”
Reviews.Author: pnmehta
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance 57 looks modern and has a classic NY City building facade. But, once you step in you are disappointed with the general decor and upkeep of the place. The ambience and decor looks quixotic and outdated. The place looks in need of refurbishment and the restaurant and bar leave a lot to be desired. Having landed in the middle of an anticipated onslaught by Hurricane Irene we were forced to be in the hotel over the weekend and found the staff to be very attentive and friendly to our needs. The location is excellent in the heart of the Manhattan in the Upper East Side very strategically situated to all the main areas of the city. That was perhaps the saving grace in the hotel. Marriott needs to update this property and make it a modern chic hotel to match the competition because I for one would not want to visit it again in its present state.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but tiny.”
Reviews.Author: carlosfidelis
Reviews.Content: I didint payed the stay at this hotel cause i spent my marriott rewards points so I can not claim a lot...but if i was paying certainly I would turn around and get away after getting into the room. Its in a great location, in an area that I know very well cause I stay at Lombardy Hotel (one block from it) in others trips to Ny.Close to everything ( metro, shops, pharmacies, central park, churches) It tryes to be TRENDY, MODERN but looks like a dollÂ´s room house. Can be called an boutique hotel but its the Fitting room of the boutique for the room size! A bar-restaurant in the entrance gives some movement to the lobby. I had a sympa welcome kit in my room of one half wine bottle and some almonds. The air conditioning is noisy and some moments it hides the noisy NEW YORK outside the window. Expensive wireless but you can use 15 minutes free per day in some computers in the office room.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: RonaldoDaSilva
Reviews.Content: Perfect location close to 5th Avenue shopping district, Bloomingdale's and Central Park. Attentive staff, hassle-free option. I highly recommend and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “They try, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Markthebest
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel. Not quite to Renaissance standards, but they're getting there. This is an old building and with that, it has its quirks-old elevators, small rooms, old style A/C units. The top benefit is the location--57th and Lexington Avenue. From there, you have access to everything midtown. Downside is the noise since the windows are not all that great, soundproof-wise. I was told that the windows and the A/C will be updated. By then the only issue is the small or "cozy" rooms. They are cozy, and fine for a single or even double traveler, but not more than that. if you like spending a lot of time in your room, this is not the place for you. If you want Marriott comforts (lounge, points) and location is key, and you spend most of your time enjoying the excitement that is NYC, which is advisable, then stay here. Good fitness center for a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Despite Positive Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Trackrunner1010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend in the city. I wanted to make it special and decided to splurge a little on a room with a terrace. I found a deal on their website for Valet Parking included in the room price and also two free drinks ($15 max). The lobby is on the second floor which is a little odd but they tell you where it is on the way in. The lobby was very modern and a little quirky but overall not bad. We arrived before our room was ready so they checked our bags for us and we heading out for a day exploring the city. We came back around 2:30 PM and our room was ready. They said they would send our bags right up but an hour later they still had not showed up. I called down for them and they sent them up in about 5 minutes. The room was quite small but the terrace had a great view and a small bistro table. We ordered room service for a late lunch, the price was quite hefty and the quality unimpressive (nearly $70 for two hamburgers and fries). The bathroom was nice except the shower had very little water pressure and was very difficult to shower in. The pocket door in the bathroom did not lock and also did not block any sound so there's not very much privacy. The air conditioner cooled the room well but was very loud and woke us every hour when it kicked back on. The Queen bed was at best a Full bed and was not very comfortable. For breakfast the next morning we again ordered room service. When it arrived I noticed they had forgotten the bacon in my meal. They did send it up when I called down for it but it took around a half hour and I had already finished eating. This meal was close to $80 for two breakfasts and was probably worth at most $40. Upon checking out I noticed that they had included a charge for the parking despite it having been included in the bill. When I mentioned it they corrected it but it makes you wonder how often that happens. Be sure to check your bill for inaccuracies! All in all, the best part of this hotel was probably the terrace and the Valet parking. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great price, great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: lncooper529
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel for the 4th of july wknd for my husbands bday. i told them when i booked that we were celebrating a bday and they upgraded us to a suite. all hotels in nyc are small, so dont expect anything large. service here was great. the people were really nice. the rooftop terrace was amazing. the view was wonderful and the atmosphere of the whole place was spectacular. i would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service, loved the vibe, loved the people. We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Jewel21Dance
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Hotel 57 on a saturday night. I was soooo pleased. Everyone from the valet, check in, concierge was just so friendly, helpful and seemed like they really wanted us to enjoy our stay. Brian the Operations Manager introduced himself and was on hand to welcome us and ensure we had a great stay. Joey at the Concierge Desk was so helpful with reservations. We ate at BLT and had a great time. The waitress at breakfast (forgot her name) was also very kind. The room was VERY small but they made good use of space. The bathroom was enormous compared to others in standard rooms I've stayed. And the closets were large as well. We didnt spend much time in the room so it didnt matter to us. I would suggest though asking about the larger room. They didnt have availability for our night but I did hear they have larger rooms. All in all, I would absolutely stay at Hotel 57 again. Service is awesome, the vibe is quite hip and you can't beat the price for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Staff, Great Service...shine in Midtown.”
Reviews.Author: SundysWT
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Manhattan at Hotel 57. There were 4 of us staying in a standard room with 2 beds and was a bit cramped but you expect that in the City and beat buying 2 rooms. 48 days on an around the world trip will have anybody trying to economize. Rooms were well furnished and the hotel was in a great location at 57th and Lexington. Easy walk to Madison Shopping, Central park and Rockfeller center... a bit further to time square. Great access to subways off of 59th. Nicely furnished. Staff was great. Bell captain Pernell was phenominal, got to know the family and was always looking out for us with umbrellas and good advice on everything from restauarants to laundry. He was a great guy and made a huge impression onall of us. Equally was engaging and wonderful was Joey Wyskowski, the concierge. He gave us great recommendations for dinner, shopping, sites, subways you name it. When we discribed what we were looking for, he instantly came up with a great recommendation. After 48 days on the road, we have come to the conclusion that people defined our experience and Joey and Pernell were at the top of our trip list. Thanks guys for an unforgettable stay in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean and friendly, although small room”
Reviews.Author: KrlosMadrid_Spain
Reviews.Content: Me and my couple spent 4 nights and the experience was good, I recommend to visit the roof terrace but bring your own beverages

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with location!”
Reviews.Author: kywillia
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel with a spiffy restaurant and rooftop bar. Â Views are stunning and the atmosphere is great! (for the NYC budget price) The rooms were very clean and the hotel staff were nice. Â The only thing I didn't like was that the flat screen TVs were located in the closet. Â The doors kept closing and I needed to prop something against the door to keep it open. Â This is very minor. Â I stayed in this hotel for $159 during may and $239 in July 2011. Subway is very convenient and there is a spa, two Starbucks and a Duane Reade close by. Â I will continue to stay here while in NYC. Â  Food in the restaurant was fantastic. Â In the evening, the hotel bar is a scene....

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for shopping in NYC”
Reviews.Author: kgvad
Reviews.Content: July shopping spree in NYC - go to Hotel 57! Perfectly situated for the "shop and drop"! Great shopping in any direction (not to mention just up the street from Tiffany's!) when your arms are full, drop them off with the bell captain, and he'll bring them up to your room! The rooms are super clean with fabulous down comforters and pillows. The lobby is fabulous with hand-blown art glass and custom leather chairs. Never had a chance to try room service, but the bar made a great Gin & Tonic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelForever58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before embarking on a cruise out of Manhattan. - The staff is enthusiastic and helpful- Katie at the front desk and Joey the concierge were very helpful us get checked-in and later, out to enjoy the dinner we had planned. - The rooms are small, though we were upgraded to a junior suite. - The room was a bit tired and not as tidy as I would have liked-- the rug was one of those dark colors that made me wonder. - The passage door into the bathroom had three panels and the bottom panel had not been cleaned- but the top two panels had been cleaned... - Cabbies might not know the hotel by its current name, so be sure to have the address and let them know it is on 57th at Lexington.

Reviews.Title: “A great old NY hotel with a fresher look”
Reviews.Author: fsview11
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night but was overall very happy with my stay. I was upgraded from the small room to a decent size room for NYC. The hotel was renovated in 2008 according to their Web site but I had a hard time believing they picked purple carpet in 1998. There were cigarette burn marks on some of the furniture in my room so I think its possible that it didn't get a 100% make over during the renovation. The bed was great, big flat screen TV. I was on a low floor so during the morning there was quite a bit of noise from traffic. The rooftop terrace had a great view and they do an evening reception there for a fee at night, weather permitting. The lobby bar was very nice and not bad prices for a NYC hotel. I would stay there again as long as the rate wasn't too high.

Reviews.Title: “First experience of NY - was ok”
Reviews.Author: fonenurse
Reviews.Content: Was under renovation so needs to be assessed with that in mind. Rooms clean and offered exactly what I expected. Was part of a package holiday which I very much enjoyed

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly cool”
Reviews.Author: lawdogs1
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I like the business amenities that the Renaissance usually offers. In that area it did not disappoint. Choosing to stay a little off the beaten path, meaning away from the bustle of Times Square and the throngs of vacationers, I was pleasantly surprised by the urban vibe here. The bar was always hopping, Madison avenue is a block away, and Central Park just a little further. This hotel has a lovely rooftop bar for rewards members that was quite enjoyable. Beware, the rooms are very small, even for New York standards. The bathroom needed updating, it had a very deep tub I had to crawl into to take a shower. I also dislike shower curtains in hotels (glass doors are always cleaner and more up to date), and I grew weary of this flimsy shower curtain. But the room was kept very clean, the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and then service excellent. The concierge lounge, for the Marriott rewards members, was actually very nice and well stocked. There is a fitness Center, mainly cardio equipment and some free weights. While this wasn't the most luxurious place I've ever stayed, I enjoyed the location, funky decor and amenities far more than I thought I would. I also had no problems with noise here, but the view was nothing to speak of (although I suspect this hotel is not known for it's views). Overall a very nice stay with great restaurants close by and fab shopping, MOMA and the park all right there.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel near Big Apple Shopping”
Reviews.Author: BGMNJ
Reviews.Content: This was second time staying at this hotel. This is a relatively new hotel in an older building. Very contemporary - rooms very nicely furnished, although a bit small which is mostly true of east side hotels. Bathrooms are well appointed. Rooms on Lex Ave side can be noisy from busy street below. Very nice breakfast. MAjor shopping nearby - Bloomingdales, etc and 5th Ave stores are within walking distance. Lovely rooftop lounge when weather permits.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to bookend business trip”
Reviews.Author: GoCrows123
Reviews.Content: Great location, cool feel, close to everything. Room was compact but fine and bed was comfortable. Staff were great nice bar and band.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: KEADSM
Reviews.Content: King rooms were nice and clean but small. Lots of problems with the air conditioning, but to be fair in was 100 degrees outside, and the maintenance people fixed the problems quickly. We had free breakfast vouchers for the lobby restaurant. The food was good, but the service was poor both mornings that we ate there. We will probably try a different hotel next time.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: mary2go
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights for a quick visit at the end of a business trip. We had a junior suite on the 14th floor. The room was pretty small for a junior suite. It was nicely decorated and well arranged. The bathroom had a nice large shower. The employees were all friendly and helpful. The doorman was even handing out bottled water to help combat the heat. The A/C worked great in the 104 degree heat!The only drawback was no pay per view movies?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel perfect for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Pedsdmd
Reviews.Content: Stay during Memorial weekend and had a single double room. hotel was clean and quiet. Newly renovated with a very nicely appointed room and bathroom. room was small but you dont stay in NYC to stay in your room. Great location on the upper East side, close to Central Park, 5th ave etc.. Great place to stay if you want relative peace and quiet

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, good for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: LisaMEngelbrecht
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a whim with out much reseach as we had one night free in New York before we could check into our time share down the road. We arrived extremely early off our international flight, so the rooms weren't ready, to be expected, but the hotel was happy to store our luggage so we could go out for the day. On a whole we really enjoyed it. The hotel (for us) was very well located, in Midtown, a couple of blocks from times square and central park. We only found the staff to be a little snooty. The rooms (I booked the cheapest ones) were very small, but as I said we were only there for one night so this didn't bother us too much. By american standards they would probably be considered "tiny". But the beads were comfy and rooms spotlessly clean. You could also tell a lot of money, time and effort had been put into the design, and the Hotel is extremely beautiful. Would I stay again? I am not sure, if it was a good deal probably, for one or two nights.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: Fergatude
Reviews.Content: Great friendly staff amazing location. Great rooms not too small. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best use of a small space”
Reviews.Author: Wkonsunshine
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in larger hotel rooms in NYC, but this small room had a better lay-out than the bigger ones. The bathroom was a treat! I enjoyed the hotels ambiance and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The location is perfect for walking and very close to a subway line. My only disappointment was a lack of free internet. It is a convenience that is sorely missed in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: selytina
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location--we walked everywhere, museums, Times Square, theaters etc. We had 4 travelers in our group, so it was necessary to find a room with 2 double beds and that was not easy to find in New York. The room was small, but I expected that. Joey, the concierge, was the best. I will say that the reviews I read before were pretty accurate. The elevators were a little glitchy and small. I wish the doorman had mentioned that the check-in was upstairs, as we walked in the front door we stood in line thinking it was check in, but that was the concierge. Housekeeping left a little to be desired as one day our room was still not cleaned by 3:30 in the afternoon and we never had enough towels for four people until the last day. The air conditioner was a little loud, but it is July and so hot, so any working air conditioning feels good. We never ate at the hotel as breakfast was over $25. There is a wonderful diner just two doors down as well as a Starbucks with free wi-fi (the hotel charges $16 a day). Overall, I think I would go back because the location was so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: pinklady1177
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights/5days, and enjoyed it tremendously! The hotel has a very chic decor which fits in perfectly with the east side. It was a great location for shopping at bloomingdales, as well 2 blocks from the nearest subway station. The restaurant has top notch "free" entertainment with comforting menu. The highlight of my stay was the friendly,helpful stay.The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Once again Hotel 57 delivers”
Reviews.Author: SeekTheBest
Reviews.Content: Once again Hotel 57 delivers on all levels. Hubby whisked me off to NYC as a birthday surprise, just a quick trip to my fave hotel and to take me to my fave restaurant for dinner. Joey, our concierge arranged for a car to pick us up at JFK and made sure our dinner reservations were set. He also recommended a great sushi place which we loved and for which I will write another review. Our room was perfect, everything at this hotel is always "spot-on". It is the only hotel I will ever stay in when I am in NYC. It is a small boutique hotel, but it's just perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a New York city break...”
Reviews.Author: iamtripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 3 night city break; the staff were really friendly and helpful and we had a really nice modern, clean room....it was a bit small but rooms do tend to be small in NY, no problem with this. The hotel is near to Bloomingdale's, has a subway stop just across the road and it's only a fairly quick walk away from central park. It was a bit noisy when getting to sleep but there again we are in a very busy city so can't really complain about this. We didn't eat at the hotel as we spent the majority of time out in the City but there was always some fresh fruit available in the reception area which was a nice touch when you're heading out for the day. We had no problems at all and would stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a wonderful neighbourhood.”
Reviews.Author: LuizAlf
Reviews.Content: Even for New York Standard the room is small. But, probably, this is the only problem that I found in the hotel. In fact, the rooms are extremely clean and tidy and so is the hotel. Renaissance 57th is localized in a wonderful neighbourhood, with lots of coffee shops, restaurants and drugstore. The subway station is only 3 blocs away, and the staff very polite and helpful (Nicole is the best member of the staff). My wife and I had an unforgettable time there. So, I truly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lobby, and Lounge”
Reviews.Author: HazleW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on points so the total bill for the weekend - three nights! - was $12.80. Not bad!! The room was very small (like the cabin on a ship) and a little worn, but there was a nice view of the city, the bed was super comfortable, and there were great blackout shades so it was possible to sleep in. But no cable TV! That was weird. Great bathroom, great shower, and very nice people who work at the hotel. Also the hotel has a very pretty lounge area in its second floor/mezzanine lobby where it's possible to hang out, which was great. The location is so convenient as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location. small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelbeat
Reviews.Content: The only knock is the small rooms and bathroom. If you would like bathroom privacy this is not your place. Thin glass pocket doors and no sound proofing makes for lack of privacy. If you are all alone, no problem. On the corner of 57th and Lexington Ave, it is a great location. two or three blocks from Central Park, Bloomingdales (and other shopping) within a short short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: 1WS
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here over the weekend of May 14-15. Our room was small, but very clean and the furnishings were quite modern and stylish. Our beds very super comfy. The staff was helpful and polite, but not overly friendly or intrusive. The location was great! Close to the subway, restaurants and great shopping (Bloomingdales, Barneys, Dylan's Candy Bar, etc).. It was a nice walk to Madison Av shopping, Central Park and Broadway, but far away from the Times Square hoards. I would love to stay here again during my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: thefrequenttraveller
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great, the decor downstairs was great, but it was so frustrating that they didn't get the elevators working for the first day. I might try this place once more as it is well located and a bit unsual.

Reviews.Title: “Extra special treatment”
Reviews.Author: Par4Life
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel to spend a long weekend in NYC and celebrate our wedding anniversary. When booking, my husband let them know it was a special occasion for us. When we arrived, we were given congratulations and a small complimentary gift of our choice (snack and drink) which would be delivered to our room, as well as a slight room upgrade. Also, our room was ready and we got to check in early! Later, that evening, when we arrived back there was a lovely cheese tray and a split of champagne, which had been ordered by the reservationist who had spoken to my husband.. This is in addition to the smaller gift offered by the cordial gentleman that checked us in. Such a lovely and classy touch. The hotel is very nice and in a great location. So convenient to everything, including shopping and subways. Rooms are New York City small, but are quite well appointed. I absolutely loved the comfort of the bed and the soft, fine linens. We are Marriott Rewards members and always try to stay at Marriotts. Renaissance may have become our favorite part of the hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...with a couple of 'issues'....”
Reviews.Author: klsummer09
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay and overall it was terrific. The pros.... Instant free upgrade on check in to a larger room (due to being a 'silver member'). The room was very clean and sleek, with a lovely bathroom and nice features like a safe and flat screen TV. Bed VERY comfortable with great comforter and four pillows! Wonderful Aveda products supplied the bathroom (soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotion only). Internet access was charged but credited back on check out (again due to 'silver' status). Staff in hotel was flawless at check in, drinks in the bar in the evening (live jazz band), and housekeeping. The housekeeper was lovely and accomodating to requests for extra soap etc. We stored our luggage for several hours at checkout (12 noon! So much better than 11:00!) and the bellhop was terrific also. Great location! The Cons: The platform bed invites banging shins against the corners when walking around the room.. This is NOT because our particular room was too small, just poor design of the bed and the corners being hidden under the comforter. There were only two bath sized towels in the bathroom. At least one more would have been helpful. Also no hooks in the bathroom for wet towels, etc. The most important CON was arriving in the restaurant for Easter Sunday breakfast/brunch. We were seated (at a table with incomplete settings) only to wait over ten minutes with no attention. We were then informed that the restaurant was closed for the next 30 minutes so they could change over from breakfast to brunch. We left wondering why the 'Special Easter Brunch' was advertised as starting when we arrived and feeling like the service really lacked in professionalism and simple manners. No apology, no nothing. Just "we're closed for the next half hour; if you want to come back then, that's fine". It was such a downer way to end the stay. We were able to see what the 'cozy' rooms look like as opposed to the room we were upgraded to, and they are seriously small in comparison. All in all I would absolutely definitely return to this hotel for the room, the overall service and the bar in the evening but I would not return for a meal in the restaurant.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “For $1400 bucks you too can sleep on the floor”
Reviews.Author: smalaveetil
Reviews.Content: We booked this over our daughters' spring break. We didn't mind paying a premium to stay in New York City. Little did we know that the hotel would make us sleep on the floor. When we reserved the room we reserved it for four people: me, myself and our two daughters (7 and 4). When we arrived the hotel indicated that they had no rooms with double beds. They did however, promise a roll away bed. However, that promise was unfulfilled come night time. The manager on duty (Ms. Lewis) informed us that all the hotel could do for us was provide us some "comforters" and pillows so we could sleep on the floor. There was no offer to provide us with another room, for us to switch hotels or even provide us with a partial refund. I have been a fairly loyal Marriott customer. After tonight, I will never stay at this hotel and think twice before ever staying at another Marriott property ever again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel surprised me!”
Reviews.Author: Palina
Reviews.Content: This hotel surprised me in a good way! I had a conference two blocks away from Hotel 57. I really needed to be in walking distance and this was as close as I could get. I as afraid the age of the hotel would be gloomy but it was totally charming. I found many of the guests were regulars at this hotel and were happy with the small hotel feel you get from the concierge and the staff. I read about small rooms but I went with the deluxe double and had a corner room that was much larger than the Renaissance Time Square I had previously stayed at. The bath was incredible and so were the beds. What I loved most about this hotel was feeling so comfortable and at home. The concierge (Geoffrey) was wonderful to us. My son (adult) took ill on this trip and Geoffrey sent up a well-kit that was incredible. The hotel manager stopped in to check on my son as well. The concierge level on the second floor had a wonderful breakfast for Silver and up members. The restaurant and bar were lively. If I have to travel alone to NYC I would stay here. I could go anywhere and feel safe. Good Chinese food nearby at Fuchias and we loved a deli lunch at Picnic at 57.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend... OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterJ73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Hotel 57 and found the rooms to be comfortable if a bit small for the price we paid in NYC. There was some obvious wear and tear on the walls, especially those nearest the desk. The bathroom was clean with everything in working order. Our one slight problem was related to the shower and the amount (or lack there of) water pressure.
