I couldn't tell if it was a building issue (we were on the 12th floor) or if it was the fact that the shower head seemed to be corroded a good bit. Other than that, we were happy with the room. The staff was friendly and helpful. They scored big points in my book by having a room ready for us by 11:30 AM. This was an unexpected surprise and sure made our first day in the city much more comfortable. The 57 is in a good location with easy access to Subways, restaurants and shopping. All-in-all, a good experience and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location small room!”
Reviews.Author: AffairsinMiami
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the weekend of Jan 28, it was freezing cold and snowing in NYC but coming from Miami, I was excited about the change in weather. When I arrived, I checked in immeditely. the front desk agent was nice and friendly but when i asked a few questions about the surrounding area, she was not aware of what i was referring to (I visit NYC quite often and for being an out of towner, I feel I know the city well). I then went up to the second floor and spoke with the concierge for a few minutes. She was helpful, friendly and knowledgable. My room was on the 9th floor, tucked away in the corner of the hall. I was ok with the location, as it was far away from the elevator and not necessarily in a busy hallway. The actual room however, was super tiny! Dont get me wrong, I was not expecting a suite but just thought it was a bit too cozy for me. I had an amenity waiting in my room since I am an Elite Marriott member and thought it was such an important detail - didnt have to pay the $12 they charge for a large bottle of FIJI water!! The furniture was damaged and not at its best condition. The bathroom was, to my surprise, very spacious (well appreciated) and the amenities were from Aveda, one of my favorite products! The door holders and bellboys were great, I have several interactions with them and they were amazing. I even shared a cupcake (hard for me to do since that is probably the only thing in the world I am selfish about!!) with the bellhopper, Alex. He was very friendly and suggested one of his favorite sushi restaurant down the street from the hotel called Ginger. I recently visited NYC in early March (stayed at a diff property) and came back on the last day of my trip to bring Alex a cupcake, to my very surprise, I was greeted by the same bell hops and they remembered me and wecomed me back! Without any doubt, it would be my pleasure to visit this property again (i will reserve a larger room next time!!)

Reviews.Title: “Small, tired rooms, but decent staff and a good location”
Reviews.Author: Maclock
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 57 during January's Snowmageddon. On the whole, I found the staff to be equal parts delightful and helpful. The rooms, on the other hard, are a bit banged up and poky. Upon check-in, I was upgraded to a larger room because so many rooms were unoccupied. All I have to say is that if this is what passes for a larger room, then I would hate to see how small the smaller, normal rooms must be. One other quirk: the room I was put in had no in-room safe. When I reported this to one of the receptionists, I was told that there should be one in there. Odd. By the way, there might be some collusion between the doormen and certain cab drivers. One driver, who gets a lot of business from a certain doorman, immediately pressured me to agree to a flat rate $30 fare to LGA. The doorman told me that I should be suspicious of anyone who tries to charge me any more than $30; that $30 should be about right. Given the agreement between the sums quoted by the two gentlemen, I wonder if the doorman isn't getting a cut of that $30 to keep referring fares to the driver in question. Now, I know that it isn't unusual for cabbies to give themselves a bit of an income boost by doing off-meter runs, but this seemed to be a bit too cute by half. I wonder if the fare would have been any less had I told the cabbie to run the meter?

Reviews.Title: “Great location lovely rooms, great view from the r lounge bar !!!”
Reviews.Author: Food113
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel is the location.rooms are fresh,clean and comfy beds.would return and tell friends about this hotel.. To stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: kirsty007
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in New york 3 times in the last year so I know how expensive hotels are and how small rooms are but this hotel is exceptionally bad value. I thought I would try Priceline.... what a total con that is. This was supposed to be a 4*luxury and was at best 2*. I didn't get it very cheaply either. I asked to change room after the first night as the first was small and horrible. I had to pay $100 night for an upgrade to a bigger room which was really really run down. The bathroom glass door was cracked and sellotaped together! They never replenished the coffee and powdered milk so you had to call them to bring it, which was your only luxury in the room. Even the water cost $5 bottle. Wifi $18 day. Overall a pretty rubbish hotel and poor value for money. There are some really great hotels in New York you can stay in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Valet parked car---stolen iphone”
Reviews.Author: CarTRVLR
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, good location and a good price on a Sunday night. But I had my car valet-parked and my iphone was stolen from the glove compartment. I've valet-parked my car all over the city and never had a problem. The hotel took the information and said they would look into it, but never called back. I'm going to try and take this further but based on the other review with a car damaged from the valet parking, I'm not hoping for much. They obviously have a problem and don't care. With that attitude and the fact that someone searched my car and took what they wanted, i don't feel safe going back. Stayer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid valet service”
Reviews.Author: MMUI
Reviews.Content: I am a platinum member at Marriott. The valet service damaged my car and denied such claim by subsequently modified the valet ticket. I kept the original valet ticket and showed that to the hotel and the hotel would careless. After numerous attempt, I still have not heard back from anyone. I have filed a complaint to BBB (Better Business Bureau). I gave Marriott 2 months to resolve the problem but was unsuccessful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: shiney_jo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel 57. I have been to NYC several times, and have never been treated so well. When I first entered the hotel, I was greeted with a smile and was informed that they had upgraded my room free of charge - always a pleasant surprise. While I only stayed for one night, any interaction I had with a staff member was pleasant. Each member of the staff ensured that I was taken care of. From the Janitor all the way to the front desk. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get much better”
Reviews.Author: ianfrommontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Saturday night. Was a little worried about other reviews but was very happy. Location is stellar. You are a short walk from Time Square and 30 Rock. Hotel is a little old but has been redesigned and looks quite hip. Room was spacious and ultra clean. I did the full bed bug check and it was clean. People have complained about the sounds coming from the street but common, it's NEW YORK CITY!! Staff was super helpful and for the price, I will stay there again for sure !!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Bagherailcane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance in December - room 901. We arrived and the room was cold. We put up the heat - it was still cold so we put it up to the maximum - 80 - and left. We came back late at night. Still cold. The bathroom was like an ice box and the separate thermostat obviously had no effect at all. The main heat made lots of noise - and if you put your hand on the unit there was a slight amount of heat coming out - but basically, there was no heat in the room. There was more cold air coming through the windows than heat coming out of the main unit. And again - nothing in the bathroom. It was too late to complain. I complained on the way out and was given the manager's card. I wrote to her and received no response. I'm just amazed that one can stay at a hotel of this level in NY and have no heat and no apology!

Reviews.Title: “Priceline room not so great”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: On a Priceline stay, we got the dreaded double-bedded room. The bed is not uncomfortable, but it is very noisy in the roms that face Lexington Avenue, even up on the 13th floor Our bags took over one hour to get delivered from the lobby to our room, and we had to call down for severaql items that the housekeeper had forgotten to include in our room (washcloths, coffee cups). I'll hope for other properties in this Priceline zone in future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: moonbeam51
Reviews.Content: Cannot think of a thing wrong with this hotel. Spotlessly clean, NO bedbugs, elegant lobby, extraordinarily helpful staff. The bathroom was really nice, with a huge shower. The room decor was modern, sleek, beautiful. Bed and linens were perfect. Our room was in a corner, virtually no street noise. The people who helped us, Pernell (sp?) the bellman, and Tara at the desk, were gracious and friendly, answered ridiculous questions from us, and provided us with needed information quickly. We were near Bloomingdale's, Hammacher Schlemmer, subway entrance, Lee's Art Shop, Rizzoli Bookstore. We strolled the area many times and were delighted with nearby stores and restaurants, including delis. I love New York anyway, and this hotel made our trip even more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly and efficient”
Reviews.Author: tharb
Reviews.Content: As frequent business traveller and runner, I look for a hotel close to my meetings with decent outside running, as well as a suitable gym and nice hotel amenities for an after-work drink. And always a decent breakfast before starting the day. Hotel 57 fit the bill perfectly. A Marriott property, I was ensured of that Marriott experience (I am a rewards member), but I also got the boutique feel of a different kind of hotel in the city. Approx 4 blocks from Central Park, and 6 blocks from the East River (running in both locations) and 7 blocks from most of my meetings. Eggs, coffee, juice, yogurt and assorted breads for breakfast. Eggs were a bit runny each morning, but tolerable. Room was clean and orderly, and the staff was excellent and quite friendly. Especially the concierge desk, great folks there, happy to help. Room was spacious enough for one, and had a nice work area, however, I find it appalling that I spend money for a hotel room that then charges for internet access. I spend enough on the room, why should I be nickel and dimed for things that are standard in business these days? Gym was compact and also very tidy...the equipment was sufficient for a 3 night stay and there were free weights as well as a single multi-purpose cable machine. A few treadmills and eliptical machines rounded out the room. Two blocks from subways, depending on your needs, and close to 5th Ave/59th street shopping areas. A nice diversion if you have an extra 30 minutes to putter. Was quiet (my room faced 56th/Lex) and I was comfortable in the king bed. Rooms looked newly furnished. Only downside: there was a fire alarm at 3a on my second night. Called the front desk and they told me false alarm, so all was fine, but I didn't sleep well after. Plan to stay there again due to the location, amenities and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New York Location for Shopping, Dining, Siteseeing”
Reviews.Author: loucards
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel and the location. Staff was extremely helpful and courteous. This hotel is modern and hip, but has a warm atmosphere. My room was spacious for 'New York standards' , updated, and clean - with 2 double beds and all the amenities you would need for your stay. Good linens, nice updated bathroom, flat screen tv. Location is so convenient to shopping, dining, and the subway. Short and easy walk to good restaurants, coffee, cocktails, dessert, and shopping. All the benefits of New York without having the non stop crowd and tourist traffic of Times Square. I've been to NY 5-6 times and this will definitely be my #1 hotel choice for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service all round!!!”
Reviews.Author: vallentyne
Reviews.Content: Mum and I stayed here from 14th December for 4 nights...the rooms were modern and clean and the location was excellent....check in was simple and nothing was too much trouble for them...the only thing that maybe would have been nice is if we would have been able to eat in the resturant in the evenings but as it was near xmas there were private fuctions every night we were there!!would defo stay there every time though...well done Renaissance staff:}

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spotty Service”
Reviews.Author: gqkz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on points, and for that I am very thankful. I'll try to review this hotel in the context of New York Hotels, which I am sure are very small, and very expensive. First, the location is amazing. Lexington and 57th, only 4-5 blocks from the GE building, and Central Park. It's a very expensive area, maybe lacking a little bit in normal restaurants (i.e. not restaurants that take a month to get a reservation). For tourism though, it's a great spot. The hotel itself is very nice. Nice decorations, very modern, stylish, and intimate, which is what I wanted. I hoped a smaller hotel with less guests would mean better service. There were just a few issues which got a little annoying. 1. When we arrived there was no one to help with the luggage and even after check in there was no offer to help. Not a huge deal, but expected I think at this hotel. 2. The first room we got (with points) was only a double bed. This was really really small. I was happy to have a free room, but two people cannot realistically fit on a double bed comfortably. Maybe this is how it is in New York. 3. The heater was broken. I am surprised no one noticed this before I got there. They came by and fixed it which was nice within about an hour. 4. They were able to move me to a king room, which was super nice of them! Much much better. The problem was, no heater again!! This time someone came to fix it right away, however, they never fixed it. 5. We came home from dinner / show late, at about midnight, and the heater was still broken, completely, no note, or communication or anything. Just a cold room. I call to the service number, and no one answers after multiple calls. I go downstairs to get help, and they apologize, give me some waters, and move me to another room. BTW, every time we ask for help with bags, it takes nearly 30 minutes for someone to come. Now, back into a queen room, which was very nice and comfortable. 6. The desk manager at night offered free breakfast to compensate for the situation, which was generous of him. I told him, we have plans for breakfast, but thanks anyway. Points / credit may be nice, and he said that was great. However, when we check out, a letter arrives with certificate for breakfast. I mean come on!? Other than that, great hotel. Nice restaurant with good food, and a kind of club / lounge atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “NEW YORK GETAWAY”
Reviews.Author: gvagenas
Reviews.Content: We were 6 nights in New York City. One night at Renaissance 57. Best night of trip was Renaissance 57. 17th floor, with a balcony. Room was clean with uplifting atmosphere. Bathroom was white and bright which was great. Check-in was easy. Lobby with fire, the bar and furniture was unique and iconic. GREAT STAY. GREAT LOCATION TO EAST SIDE. I would stay again and advised others for a great time to stay there. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch Staff”
Reviews.Author: JSSMetroD.C.
Reviews.Content: Got our of our car and was instantly assisted by Pernell (Bell Captain) who took care of the car and the luggage and made us feel right at home. We are former New Yorkers. What a great personality as well as helpful. Tara , at the front desk, upgraded us without us even asking. We had a corner room and it was very spacious. I think that the soundproofing could be better. Cars are honking at all hours of the night but that's New York.And I think that the new Hilton beds are a bit more comfy. But this was certainly comfortable enough. NO Bed bugs here at all. William Bravo, at the front desk, assisted us when we left with a great map quest. Over and above service all around this "boutique" hotel.On our way in from a day of walking Chris, who is the Dir. of Finance for this and another Marriott, greeted us like we were his best friends. We chatted and it turned out he went to High School near where we live. Marriott should be proud to have him on staff. Breakfast was fine. We walked to and from Lincoln Center and although it was more than 10 blocks it was easy enough. Consider this lovely property for your stay in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Wow”
Reviews.Author: ilava
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights using our reward points. This hotel could not have been better. We were there for our 40th anniversary and while we were unpacking our bell boy brought up a cheese and fruit platter and a bottle of champagne from the manager. The hotel is decorated in a very eclectic type of decor, but is very tastefully done. The restaurant located on the premises is very good too, but the neighborhood is filled with outstanding places to eat. The location is wonderful as you can walk everywhere a feel quite safe. Only a short walk to Central Park. Highly recommend this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “When can i go back!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetTO
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay with this hotel. I booked the room through priceline so I got a great rate. In the booking it stated that I had gotten a double bed room - which is not what it originally said in the priceline description pre-booking. So I made some calls to priceline management and the hotel and got a free upgrade to a king room. The room was on the small side but the bed was extremely comfortable, bathroom was very clean and nicely designed and the room itslef was very modern and new. The staff at this hotel were amazing - everyone was so attentive and polite and they quickly answered questions and got us great dinner reservations. It was a nice touch to get free bottled water on arrival at the check in desk and some more with some free snacks in our room upon check in. The lounge Opia was also a very trendy and well designed spot - the Hallowe'en party was packed full and tons of fun. The location of this hotel is great as it is close to shopping, the metro and many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: irwins0001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, etc. Very clean with modern amenities and an excellent staff. It has a nice lounge, club, and work out room. Yes, the rooms are small, but that has been my exp. throughout Manhattan. I booked direct through the hotel and got the prepaid room I reserved for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chain Hotel w/ Its Own Boutique Character”
Reviews.Author: lagniappe34
Reviews.Content: I spent a night there using a Marriott Rewards stay. I was staying in Hotel Hell at the Roosevelt for work (read my post on that, if you dare) and decided to stay an extra night in the city and switched to the Renaissance. This was a stylish, well-situated hotel that has a great boutique feel. The entrance is right on 57th. Check-in is on the floor below the hotel lobby. You must take an elevator up to the lobby after check-in and then a different elevator to your room. It's confusing the first time but fine once you know where you're going. I was most impressed with the decor. Very Sleepy Hollow-like, in my opinion. Lots of chocolate browns, nature-inspired bronze statues and beautiful glass-blown pieces decorate the public spaces. The rooms are large for New York. Very modern with a light wood closet/entertainment center/desk piece as the room's focal point. I was scheduled to have a "larger queen room" but was given a comfortable king bed. The bathrooms are just as pictured by other travelers' photos. Natural stones, modern fixtures, Aveda products, plenty of space for a single girl with lots of products. The staff was lovely. The front desk attendant couldn't have been nicer and gave me a bag of chocolate covered raisins as a welcome gift. A manager on duty personally thanked me for choosing the hotel, especially impressive since I wasn't paying for it. The bellman was perfect, storing my bags after checkout and helping with a car to the airport who happened to be the best NYC driver I've ever used. The ONLY downside: tiny elevators. If you have two people with two bags in elevator, you experience sardine can-like closeness. They're tiny but it's an older, renovated property; it's what you would expect. I didn't mind but a claustrophobic would. Great chain hotel with a wonderful boutique vibe. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, at a great location, for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Jmazerolle
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel. Yes, the rooms are small, but very efficient. The location was perfect. We were 20 minutes from Times Square, and a short walk to Central Park or shopping on 5th Avenue. The staff was friendly and attentive. The door staff was always asking what we were up to, if we need anything, and would offer us bottles of water at every occasion. I was a bit jealous that I booked 2 rooms, and my brother got the one on the 16th floor with a view of the Chrysler building (we were on the 6th floor). Booking through Priceline, we got a great deal. The staff obviously couldnâ€™t care less how I booked my room, and gave warm and attentive service. The other reviews that think that guests are treated differently depending on how they book rooms are silly. The room are beautifully decorated, and the washrooms are excellent. Everything seems to be at the right place, which makes the room feel larger then it really is. We spent very little time in the room, so the smaller size didnâ€™t bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: HLWCdn
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a great location in New York. The rooms were clean, recently renovated and very quiet. The bathroom was very spacious and the iPod dock was a nice touch. The hotel is very close to several subway lines making travelling around the city very easy and convenient. It's also very close to Central Park and great shopping. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Artsy Boutique Hotel with tons of charm”
Reviews.Author: MOS44
Reviews.Content: We loved our anniversary stay here in Manhattan in this artsy boutique hotel. The decor is charming and whimsical, and the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. We stayed two nights, in two different rooms which varied greatly in size...the first was very tight, but the second was extremely spacious. The staff also let us have complimentary continental breakfast. Overall, a high recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Booked on Priceline, no problems.”
Reviews.Author: WaitingForMyNextTrip
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline and paid Â£195 per night. The website rate about Â£287. I was worried after reading some reviews on here about Priceline customers, but absolutely everyone was charming to us. The interior of the hotel was fabulous, very boutique and interesting. Great bar with good atmosphere, not like a big chain hotel at all. Also, they have a business centre where internet access is free for first 15 mins per day which is very useful. The downside was the room are tiny, the bed is double and you can just walk around it. BUT, that's NYC hotels for you. Despite being small, the bathroom was gorgeous and looked brand new. The whole room looked very well kept and maintained. We were also told that if we did want a larger King room we could upgrade for $75 per night. Midtown hotels of good quality are just expensive with tiny rooms, that is the price you pay unfortunately, especially with the current exchange rate. But given what was available and what I wanted for the money I was willing to pay, this was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT USE PRICELINE TO BOOK!!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTraveler00
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline to book this hotel and was RIPPED off by Priceline! I entered in a 4+ star hotel and they gave me the Renaissance New York Hotel 57 which on various sites is ranked as a 3-3.5 star hotel NOT a 4+ star hotel! They took my price and gave me a lower ranked hotel and when I called to dispute it they said they have their own ranking system! They wouldn't even try to listen to my complaint and said no one at their office could help me and they have no supervisors I could talk to! They rope you in by promising a nicer hotel and then give you a hotel that is lower ranked. Although yes this hotel looks nice, I am paying way more to stay here than is worth it! The Reniassance Hotel's website even lists it for less than we are paying! And for my husband and myself we only get a double bed because Priceline does not factor in the bed situation. PLEASE TAKE MY ADVICE AND DO NOT USE PRICELINE! You will be disappointed and they will mislead you!! This is my first and LAST time using Priceline!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: krhoben
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay....great location, wonderful service, "boutique" size, Aveda toiletries- loved, fabulous bed.....would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: L0ve-2-Vacati0n
Reviews.Content: I just got home from my sisters Bachelorette Party Weekend and had to write a review of this hotel. I have stayed at hotels all over the world and have NEVER had service the way I had here. I am a native New Yorker but haven't "vacationed" or been a "tourist" of the city before. Amazing does not even seem to be a proper word but I cannot think of another. We arrived on Friday afternoon and had a very easy check-in. We stayed in the Sky Loft Suite, room 1701. Now yes I will say it was pricey, but for a special occasion TOTALLY worth it. The terrace overlooking 57th street was spacious and comfortable. Every single employee that we encountered greeted us with a smile and wanted to make sure we were happy. We had to chase 2 of the gentleman down the hall to give them a tip!! We asked for a refrigerator and extra chairs for the terrace, when they heard we were a bachelorette party they brought us 9 chairs and 2 fridges. If we had a need it was solved in under 5 minutes. The room was comfortable, spacious, VERY CLEAN, Keuring coffee pot definetly an added plus. We did however have 1 complaint, we had received complementary breakfasts for our stay at Opia. While the breakfast was SCRUMPTIOUS (we highly recommend hte southern breakfast and the almond pancakes) we found the main waiter to be a bit rude and discourteus. Two days in a row we had breakfast with our vouchers and both days he tried to tell us the voucher was for only 3 of the guests instead of all 4 and we found him acting VERY pleasant and accomodating to other guests while we had to wait 20 minutes for pancakes and eggs. In conclusion, because I can go on:) this was a FANTASTIC stay, wonderful people, AMAZING staff and accomodations. You all were so amazing that the guests that came to the party were even impressed (when they walked in they were formally greeted and told where we were...even top class service to those that weren't staying at the hotel). I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!! Oh yeah, if you are looking for great pizza while you are in the city check out 57 napoli next door...the brick oven pizza was amazing and the staff great.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: JB210
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. The location was unbelievable. Excellent subway access nearby and a 5 minute walk to Central Park, 5th Avenue, Bloomingdale's and to two of our favourite restaurants - Tao and Wolfgang's. We were Priceline customers and paid a little extra to get a King size bed. It was well worth it as the regular rooms with the double bed are very small. The only complaint that we had about the room was that the A/C unit was very loud. We would definitely stay in this hotel again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: netgeek
Reviews.Content: I was assigned this hotel through priceline and I was a bit concerned after reading some the reviews, however, I am happy to report a great stay!! I arrived from the airport around 10:30am. The front desk clerk was friendly and put me in a room right away on the 14th floor. The hotel lobby was clean, neat and trendy. As previous reviewers have mentioned, the lobby is two levels and requires going up stairs or taking a elevator to reach the main bank of elevators. One of the downsides to this hotel is that you can find yourself waiting awhile for an elevator (to take you the your room). However, I have noticed this in several hotels in Manhattan The room itself was incredibly small. I've never seen anything like it. However, it was clean, modern and trendy. I expected a small room given it is in Manhattan. The bed was ultra comfortable with luxury linens. There was a nice ipod dock/clock radio and a LCD tv. This was the first time I actually received HDTV in a hotel room. It was pretty cool. The bathroom was quite spacious and very modern. Overall I thought the room met my needs. I would like to highlight the great service from the concierge (Meg I believe). She was extremely friendly and got me where I needed to go. She even gave me her contact information for when I was out and needed mobile assistance. The location of this hotel is IDEAL. It is in a very trendy part of Manhattan near the Four Seasons and luxury botiques. Really neat. One of the only downsides to this hotel was the outrageous internet price. I was charged over $30 dollars over 2 days for 2.5 hours of internet use. A little crazy if you ask me. All in all I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and Alluring Design”
Reviews.Author: CzarinaPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was comfortable in an updated modern way, and the staff was accommodating. Service was prompt. When my arms were encumbered, the upstairs lobby attendant noticed and walked across the lobby to press the button for the elevator for me. The rooms seemed quite new and the bathrooms were lovely. We were Priceline customers and were treated very well.

Reviews.Title: “Beware priceline user and terrible pillow/bed”
Reviews.Author: trip123_10
Reviews.Content: Use priceline bidding - 4 stars, central manhattan, got it for $155. When check in, I was informed that the room will not fit 2 adults and 2 small children (the room for priceline is a small room with one full size bed). However, they have availability for larger room for additional $50++. We opt to upgrade (no other option). Room was nice, newly renovated. Bed and pillow are the worst we have ever experienced in any hotel we've stayed, including several marriott's properties in manhattan. To summarize, nice hotel to stay because of the location, newly renovated, priceline user be careful (specifically if you need bed larger than full size), bed and pillow are the worst (bring your own pillow).

Reviews.Title: “Modern / Trendy Renovated Property”
Reviews.Author: RJFlyer
Reviews.Content: Marriott purchased this botique hotel and executed a complete renovation. The hotel has a unique layout (two-level lobby) and a modern sophisticated style. The restaurant/bar is always packed, but I did not try it myself. The room was very stylish. There is lighting underneath the bedframe and the bathrooms are terrific. Some rooms have verandas. If you are looking for a Marriott property that falls outside the standard design box, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for NYC - clean and updated”
Reviews.Author: Explorer852
Reviews.Content: Finding a nice hotel in NY can be pretty tricky, especially if you don't want to fork over the $500+/nt for the high end hotels (which are very nice- just pricey). This place was a nice little surprise. Not the best I've stayed in, but it was clean, quiet, and in a good location, and for the price, its hard to do better. The staff were very friendly, especially the gentleman working the front desk in the evenings. A few things did bother me, like the size of the rooms. Yes it is standard NY, but I was very disappointed that the standard room came with a double. The room was surprisingly clean and well appointed. Lots of wood accents and the bathroom was very nice as well. All in all, it was a nice hotel and I may stay here again if I want to do NY on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JMJ2010
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk at this hotel displayed an open disdain for Priceline customers. The clerk refused to give us what we politely requested: the quietest room available. Instead, he put us in a tiny closet-sized room right on Lexington. With the poorly insulated windows, we could hear the traffic and feel vibrations from the traffic going by. The next morning, we couldn't sleep as rush hour began, and so a nicer clerk gave us a room away from the main streets (it was more spacious, too). This second room was obviously available the day before, but the first front desk clerk apparently didn't feel us "Priceline people," as he called us, were worthy of it. Housekeeping was very bad--didn't leave extra shampoo like we requested, didn't refill towels, provide fresh drinking glasses, straighten up, etc. However, when we called the housekeeping button on the phone, they were very prompt in bringing us everything we needed. The laziest doorman I've ever seen, simply running from wherever he was lounging and pushing the wheelchair door-open button, but often too late, as you were already opening the door. The concierges were both good and bad: some recommended good places, others didn't have very good taste and didn't really listen to the questions we asked. Funky, trendy interior masked poor quality and design. Things felt cheap. The windows were horrendous. If you hate listening to night-club type music blaring from the lobby, don't stay here. Pros: good location, fairly new feeling, subway close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: bXMi
Reviews.Content: Location: A short walk to Fifth Avenu and two blocks to the closest subway stop makes this a good place to stay to get around. For my next visit to NY however, I would prefer a hotel close to Central Park or East/West Village or Soho where I find the dining options better. Rooms: Spotless and very clean. The size was okay judging by New York standards, but the cupboard made the room feel a bit cramped. The street view was nice, especially at night. Service: Staff were courteous and very helpful, but on several occasions there were no staff available for assistance. This happened at the reception, the bellman, doorman and concierge. On the other side I was very happy about the way they got me a fixed price taxi to the airport when leaving. I spent bonus points on my 5 night stay at Renaissance Hotel 57, but I think the rate was around $340 at that time. At this price level I do believe there are better options in New York, though I stress that I was not unhappy about the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular on all levels”
Reviews.Author: SeekTheBest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Renaissance New York Hotel 57. The location was spectacular, the view from our room incredible. We were on the 15th floor, with an outside balcony where we could enjoy a beautiful breakfast every morning. The location was such that we could easily walk to 5th Ave., Times Square, Columbus Circle, Central Park and we even walked the 3 miles to The Museum of Natural History. Our room was the perfect size, not too small except perhaps the bathroom....not much space in the way of a counter-top to lay hairbrushes on, or make-up. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant, but the menu sounded delicious. We felt the prices for breakfast were way out in left field, so we chose to go to the Greek Diner 2 doors down and have breakfast and then we found that the diner delivered, so we were able to enjoy breakfast on our terrace. All of the staff at the hotel were wonderful, in particular Daniel, a Bellman was more helpful than one could ever imagine. Our only complaint, the hotel internet. M husband had to work and needed to log into his office computer. The hotel outsources their internet service and they would not allow my husband to use his "Go To My PC" program to log into his office. He had to go to Kinkos a few blocks away to get what he needed done. What he could have done in an hour at the hotel, took an entire morning with the walking back and forth and having to wait for a free computer. That sucked. All in all, I'd highly recommend this hotel, despite the poor internet service. Next time, we'll just bring our own laptop with our own wireless card. It'll work better and won't cost anything either...the hotel also charges for internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Meets expectations”
Reviews.Author: Martin3
Reviews.Content: I quite like this hotel. Have stayed twice this year for 5 nights each time with work. The hotel is very much a boutique hotel with some funky stylish touches. The rooms I have had are small, you struggle to set-up an iron at the end of the bed. There is a fair sized gym on the 3rd floor. However, the food is very good (either sit-down a la carte) or very good quality bar snacks and dinner in the bar. The bar is intimate and staff friendly and attentive. The sushi and sashimi is super fresh and some of the best I have tasted. Thee hotel is extremely well located and accessible.

Reviews.Title: “perfect positioned very modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: eldadov
Reviews.Content: hotel 57 is perfectly positioned in the east midtown. it is very close to centeral park, 5th avenue, fancy stores and excellent restaurants and coffie shops. 2 subway stations are only couple of blocks away. loby and entrance of hotel are in seperate floors (there is elevator between them). so, at the entrance floor you have the reception and bell boys, and loby floor you have the concierege. staff is very polite and helpfull. help to order places in restaurant, recomend nightlife and give directions. room (we stayed at the junior suite) is well equipped and spacious. the street noise is little disturbing, but we didn't suffer. bathroom is beatiful, but not so functional. there is little room between tap and sink, and you cannot control the water flow, just temperature. bed is vey comfortable. room was always tidy and clean. fresh towels with good smell and fluffiness were supplied daily. the hotel is modern and looks new. security is not strong - elevators to rooms are not operated by magnetic card (even though it was supposed to), and anyone who wish to enter the hotel restaurant or events halls is passing the loby with no securty inspection. I will stay in this hotel in my upcoming visits to new york and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “You Can 'Get There From Here' and It's A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDTravelers60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in such a central location that we were able to walk everywhere that we wanted to go. If this had not been the case, there were subway stops close by and cabs that could be hailed. Our room was small but nicely furnished and very clean. We did not have any noise issues, even when we came in one night and could hear loud voices in the hallway. Once we were in our room, there was complete quiet. We were greeted with enthusiasm when we arrived by the doorman and the person checking us in. And the concierge was also extremely helpful. For two of the nights that we stayed, we did not see a doorman, but I must say that when there was someone present, they were really nice! Pernell was especially helpful and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Atmosphere in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MeadowLG
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in to when we left - we were amazed of the funky design and interior of this hotel. Located on the Upper East Side and near various subway lines - hotel was a great location for us. The picture perfect weather allowed the restaurant exterior doors to be open with table sitting on the balcony. We were upgraded when we checked in and asked for a quiet room. The room was just that and nicely furnished. You defintely felt you were not in a Marriott - by any stretch. I continue to be very impressed with the Renaissance chain - no two are alike.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy or Renaissance title.”
Reviews.Author: HoosBest
Reviews.Content: I am a elite traveler on Hilton and Marriot. This hotel continues to disappoint. Some of the loudest rooms in NYC with street noise, windows are paper thin. Rooms are smaller than any hotel other than W Hotel on Lex. Better bet for Marriot traveler is Marriot East Side. Good restaurant/bar scene, but rest of hotel subpar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: msv2010
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly, even when we checked in with a fussy toddler. They remained friendly and helpful (directions, dining options) throughout our stay. We booked through a third party site to save some money. The room was incredibly small and only had one double bed. The hotel went out of their way and honored our price while upgrading us to a larger room with two double beds. The room was very basic. Bathroom was a decent size and modern. My only complaint was housekeeping. Although friendly, they didn't do a very good job. our carpet was not vacuumed during our stay and our bedding wasn't aired out. Other than that, no complaints. Would definitely stay there again due to its close proximity to Central Park, great shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Renaissance 57”
Reviews.Author: JG_ViennaVA
Reviews.Content: Used Priceline to bid on a room in NYC. Renaissance Hotel 57 accepted my bid only because I was assigned a single double bed FOR TWO PEOPLE. I called Priceline customer service who were only sorry, but could not resolve the assigned single double bed. Renaissance only accepted my bid because they could give me a double bed (there cheapest bed) FOR TWO PEOPLE. This is simply a warning when using Priceline. I will NEVER use Priceline again, because you don't know what type of bed/room you will receive. That's the price you pay for bidding. Never again. Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value if you get a good deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ravens4ever
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance New York Hotel 57 was a great hotel and a tremendous value. My wife and I stayed there for a weekend in April and I got a room for an incredible price via their website. The location was great and close to several subway lines. The room was extremely small (just a full size bed) but was definitely modern and nicely maintained. For the value, I definitely give this hotel five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fine service - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: john3489
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with co-workers last week and we all thought it was a great spot. The rooms are all very different and interesting. Room 1703 has incredible outdoor patios - not one, but two, with views down Lexington Avenue past Citigroup Center to the Chrysler Building - fantastic room. The bed was great, everything clean and tidy, nice flat screen TV with media inputs for everything you can imagine. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Starbucks three doors to the left and also one across the street. Great restaurants nearby and two blocks from Bloomingdale's. Safe neighborhood. All in all, priced well and well worth it. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: debbierich
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night but this was a great hotel, staff stored my luggage all day while I shopped, rooms were small, as is typical for NY, but very comfortable. The bar/restaurant adjacent to the lobby was lively and we had fun having (expensive) cocktails and hor d'oeurves. The best thing about this hotel is the location. You are across from a Starbucks and a submway stop, and one block from Bloomies!

Reviews.Title: “Very small room with bad Feng Shui layout”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier68
Reviews.Content: I stayed for only a night and loved the location: walking distance to Central Park, Bloomingdales, etc. with plenty of restaurants around that offer a better alternative. The lobby and lounge/restaurant are quite hip and original, but that's about it: the rest was overall disappointing. My room was VERY small and the use of space was terrible. If interior designers don't understand some Feng Shui, they should at least have the basic common sense: who likes to sleep with one's head some 2 meters away from the room door? I could hear all the noises from the hallway, feel the air blowing under the door and did not feel safe. I actually ended up putting my suitcase between the door and the bed... Overall the room is also VERY dark and so is the bathroom. With 12 hours jet lag, it took me a while to understand how the shower worked...not intuitive at all. Good value for money at US$220/night and excellent location, but I'll consider other alternatives next time I visit NY. Overall some weird feeling about this hotel: too dark, too noisy, did not feel safe. I did not have a good night sleep - hey, isn't that what travelers ask for?!

Reviews.Title: “Great people, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbrear
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for both business and pleasure. All of my experiences have been perfect. I travel for business over 75 nights a year and stay all over the world. This hotel is one if the best. The food was great and the size of the hotel is pefect. I use to stay at the Marquee and the St. Regus but found this hotel easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, not really a great job at being "boutique"”
Reviews.Author: Lucozade_Princess
Reviews.Content: Renaissance 57 is positioned as a boutique hotel choice in mid town New York. The location is great, a few blocks away from the shops on 5th Avenue. The boutique concept though has not been executed that well. The lobby is too dark and having 2 separate lifts (first one goes to the restaurant on the 2nd floor and then you change over to another lift to take you to the hotel floors). The lifts are a mighty pain especially if you have lots of luggage. The restaurant looked nice and seemed to be frequented by a hep clientele though i did not eat there. The rooms are quite small (well it is New York after all) and i had a room without a view so nothing to great there. Being a Renaissance the beds were very comfy and i had a good nights sleep without any disturbance from the street noise. I would recommend this hotel for those visiting New York for leisure esp if you get it for less than $200/night

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel upscale and not to expensive”
Reviews.Author: tatsmom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel 57 twice for business and pleasure. The staff is so nice, the doorman actually remembered us as did our waitress at Opia restaurant located in the hotel. I am returning again , love the location, rooms are updated and comfortable and their is a great diner adjacent to hotel for quick meals.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Art_expert
Reviews.Content: Great location and comfortable beds, but our recent stay was unfortunately marred by several service problems. Front desk staff didn't seem to really care about special requests (ours and others on our behalf). They provided an amenity package that took three calls and two days to get delivered to our room. A friend sent us a bottle of wine, but the hotel lost the card that was supposed to go with it so we weren't really sure who it was from. And on the weekends, there's no daily paper available (only the weekend editions of US Today and WSJ) and no NY Times on any day. The maid didn't leave hand towels, so another call for service was required. The only staff member who came through was the concierge, Meg. These were all rather minor things, but added up we didn't think the staff delievered first class service.

Reviews.Title: “Swank Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: newnandawg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of March. I am an elite Marriott member and have stayed at many of their properties. I would rank this one towards the top. First the good: 1) Staff is incredible. From the doormen to the front desk, all were extremely helpful and kind. I would like to say Jefferey, the concierge, was very helpful each day recommending shopping places and restaurants. 2) The hotel itself is great location if you want higher end shopping. It's not a good location if you are looking for deals. 3) Hotel is recently remodeled and is swank by Marriott standards. The restaurant, Opia I believe, was packed each night as well as the bar area. If you are wanting a lively night scene this is your place. The negatives: 1) Concierge level is the bar area so at night you have to order from a list of about 8 appetizers. For breakfast the doors are closed and you have to use your card to access which is more typical. 2) The noise level is loud from the street due to not being high up. If street noise bothers you then DO NOT stay here. 3) Business Center - Well, this isn't what I call a business center when you have to pay for it. As many have said, why when you pay $250 to $350 for a room do you have to pay for internet or to use the business center. 4) TV service was sketchy at times. I've found this more and more as hotels are going to HD or digital. Nothing like getting into a movie on HBO and missing chunks of it due to signal interuptions. All in all this was a nice stay and I would recommend the hotel. Overall, we

Reviews.Title: “Superb 5 stars hotel, great location, ILNY”
Reviews.Author: TheGerm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the 57th, in front of the Bloomberg tower, and in the middle of a very trendy and chic neighborhood. It is an expensive stay, but very rewarding (read between the lines: I used my Marriott rewards so it cost me nothing!) The staff was very polite and helpful. Use the concierge's advises for restaurants around the area. Very good. The restaurant on the first floor is good and busy, but pretty expensive. Valet parking is 55$ a day, but if you park yourself, it is 51$. It is worth leaving your car in Secaucus (at the Courtyard) for free and take the bus, then take a taxi... The rooms are small but very well decorated. Stylish, modern and elegant, but on the negative side, I found that my room was not soundproof, and since I was near the elevator, I heard the bell all night. Also, when loud people walked by, it woke me up a few times. I recommend and will probably come back! Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Great bar too!”
Reviews.Author: akatklein
Reviews.Content: I had a long weekend in NYC with my sister. We were upgraded to a two bedroom - they certainly used every inch of space in this room. We had no complaints about the room - oh wait we did and they immediately came up and fixed it. The staff was AMAZING from the Concierge to the bellman - all way above average. Also a huge standout was the bartender, Russell, who made the best French Martini I have ever had. The bar is one level up from the lobby at the hotel elevator level and a cozy and somewhat swanky bar which was perfect for us to have a cocktail before going out and dessert and a nightcap at the end of our day. We loved this bar and, obviously, Russell. As a side note we had a few sushi rolls at this bar as well, the Rainbow roll was awful - as was the nicoise olive appetizer. However, both the chocolate cake and bread was fantastic. We had a room on 57th street and it was very quiet - I lived in NYC for 13 years and have never had this quiet a night sleep! But I recommend this hotel highly and will go back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Has become our favorite hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: ackisfun
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, informed concierge and the rooms are very nice. Our teenage daughter was given a very cool "nook" for her room and she was elated. It was perfectly suited for a young single person. Our room was spacious and very comfortable! This marriott renaissance is tucked away and is "just right" for size.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Henrys
Reviews.Content: Hotel renovations were just finishing when we stayed - but looked like the finished hotel was going to be fantastic. Room was pretty spacious (most city hotel rooms are quite pokey) and bathroom was lovely. Good location for sightseeing - kind of half-way between everything. Central Park in one direction (10min walk) and Rockerfellar etc about 10/15mins in other direction! Near good shopping (Bloomingdales literally across the road!) and even Tiffanys was at end of road! Hotel bar/restaurant was very cool (very popular with trendy locals - always a good sign) but a bit pricey. Door staff excellent and very helpful. Reception staff a bit slow and disorganised. Check in and out took ages and we were wrongly charged too! Would def stay here again - if got room at decent price again!

Reviews.Title: “All around perfection!”
Reviews.Author: GAmana
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this boutique hotel for a romantic weekend and highly recommend it. The location is perfect: near the best shopping, Broadway, Lincoln Center, and MOMA. The hotel is very modern and nicely appointed. Clean rooms and very friendly staff. I would also the recommend the hotel restaurant Opia for dinner, although there are many choices in the vicinity. Be sure to see the sky terrace for some great views, especially of the Chrysler Building. We plan to return again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: iztoku
Reviews.Content: I checked in rather late on Sunday night. Grabbed few bottles of water from Club Lounge and grabbed quick bite at the restaurant. My room was on the small side (one double bed in it) but I liked it. I liked the size of the bathroom as well (it was bigger then Springfield, MA Marriott one, way bigger!). Club Lounge as well as whole hotel has a nice design. As with any hotel/service it is always possible for something not be quite right. But what makes this hotel great is how employees are empowered to address the issues on the spot as well as follow up from the manager later. This hotel is definitely on the top of the list when I return back to the city. My thanks to the staff that made my stay extra special!

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: rdytogo_always
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend for stays longer than 1-2 days because there's only one very tiny closet to hang clothes and a few shelves to put clothes. Had to remove the full length ironing board to have room for my winter coat, and move coffee maker to have room for clothes. There is not even a smal chest of drawers for clothes. The bathroom was nice though with Aveda products. The lobby is a bit dark to do any reading -- more for night life, and gather hotel caters to local parties. The concierge breakfast was average, and in a smal room -- much better choice at the less pricey Residence Inn near Bryant Park, which is great for longer stays. Also, bring ear plugs - the truck traffic from Lexington may keep you awake.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline works again - great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: RHayden
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the H57 from 12/30/2009 to 1/2/2010. Excellent location, everything that you need is a short walk away; Central Park, Shops, Museums, Restaurants, & Subways. Small room but the layout works. Patience was necessary for January 1st, housekeeping service was nonexistence, the rest of the days it was fine. Made the reservations on Priceline - excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: joeyboy79
Reviews.Content: Door staff and check in staff very friendly. Allowed us to check in a little early also. Room is small but very clean. Bathroom is modern and huge flatscreen TV. Would try again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent East Side location; not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: PattySoandSo
Reviews.Content: We booked some months back and got a very respectable rate for two nights -- Christmas Eve night and Christmas Day night. Had we paid more, I would have been disappointed in the hotel. The hotel is very quiet. The restaurant therein is decent and seemingly always open. The decor is very upscale and curentl. The bed was very comfortable and nicely appointed. Our in-house coffee pot had no carafe, perhaps broken by a past guest and never replaced by management. The room was on the small size. This was not a huge issue in Manhattan, as who stays in their room for very long but to sleep whilst vising NYC. However, when I booked with Marriott, my room was listed as a "larger room". Being that it was quite small this begged the question how tiny the smaller rooms must be. The location is great, however. The hotel is on the southwest corner of Lexington Ave and 57th Street. The M57 crosstown bus stops very close going in both directions, and the N, R, W, 4, 5, and 6 trains can be gotten 2 blocks away at the Lexington Ave/59th Street station. If one is an avid retail shopper, the best of the best is close by. At 60th and Lex you have the famous flagship store of the Bloomingdales chain, plus just about anything else one might desire: Home Depot (yes), Diesel, etc. etc. Walk east on 60th from Bloomingdales, toward 2nd Ave and you are at the highly touted, much filmed tourist trap, "Serendipity III" made most famous by eponymously named John Cusack film. For more swanky stores, walk 3 blocks west from the hotel and there one will find Bergdorf Goodman department store, the flagship store of Tiffany's, the first of the Manhattan Apple stores and more.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a Marriott?”
Reviews.Author: Phillies
Reviews.Content: Even by typical NYC standards of overpriced hotels this Renaissance is an unfortunate choice. OK the location is A+. BUT at $400+ a night you can't have: 1. the tiniest rooms with beat up furniture (quasi minimal room, already looks old), lightbulbs that are off, missing curtains, blocked safe 2. a different bed type to the one requested, paid for and confirmed upon - we had confirmation for 'larger room, queen bed' got minuscule room, single bed (they called it double) - after complaining they changed the one of the two rooms we had to a king bed - the rest of our party had to share a tiny bed in the second room we had booked as only one of the two rooms could be changed... 3. no amenity replacement after second day and on one day a single set of towels replaced (we had to use hand towel for shower as we realized once in the shower...) 4. standing requests from the time of check in for the following extravagant amenities for a $400 room such as face-towels, slippers, an extra soap etc - until our check out none of these requests had even been addressed 5. considerable street and plumbing noise As a former Marriott executive I felt quite sad. As a hotelier and a traveller I felt angry and cheated. This is a poor hotel. If hotels in NYC feel they are dealing with a captive audience and can get away with things then so be it...

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: KurtBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: I am Marriott Gold and typically like Renaissance hotels but there are too many better choices in NY. Liked the location, the efficient, friendly doormen and the funky decor. But it stops there. The rooms are barren and tiny. I know this is NY but the rooms were the smallest I ever seen in NY and even the beds were minature. The hotel used to be a youth hostel and rooms still have the ulitiarian look and feel of a youth hostel. Also - the elite club lounge really isn't one as it's open to the public so be aware of the false advertising that there is a concierge lounge.

Reviews.Title: “botique hotel, botique-quality service”
Reviews.Author: IreneATL
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and here are some thoughts: Pros: Very comfy bed and linens. Very nice and quiet overall. Nice modern interior design. The doormen are always nice and opens the door for you. Great location - big brand name shops around, and only a few blocks away from Central Park, MOMA, and Serendipity3. Free internet in the lobby area. Cons: Other than the toilet tank doesn't fill up quickly (ie. you have to wait 10-15 minutes between flushes, and sometimes it just doesn't flush for reasons I don't understand - maybe our neighbor flushed and we have to wait for our turn?), I have some thoughts on its service. This hotel is marketed as a boutique hotel, but I do wish the service can step up a tad bit. - We went to the concierge to book a town car to the airport for our departure. There was a couple before us when we got there and there was no one at the counter. We all stood there for 20-30 minutes until someone finally showed up. However, she didn't apologize or explained for the prolonged absence. She does seem nice and helpful when she is there though. - The restaurant is designed nicely but the service could be improved. When we went there for dinner, no one greeted us at the front even though they weren't busy and were just chatting in the bar area. They saw us and didn't bother to come forward. Finally one of them came forward and showed us to a table, but they didn't offer a menu. We later discovered the menu was inside the drink menu and ordered our food, but realized that they offered some other guests a bigger menu. Our food arrived and the server never checked back to see if we needed anything. The guests next to our table tried for 10 minutes to get their attention so they can get some ketchup. It is not a big deal, but it gets a bit irritating. Their food is OK and their menu makes you think it were a serious restaurant, but the service is not. Just be prepared, and don't expect a lot of service like a regular restaurant. Overall it is still a very nice hotel other than a few minor hiccups.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: aspenannie
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights the week of Thanksgiving. We selected this property based on the neighborhood, the opportunity to earn Marriott points and a great rate for a newly remodeled property. However, we left after one night and moved to the Waldorf Astoria where we got a fabulous room at an even better rate - and great service. The rooms at the Marriott have been remodeled and are beautifully done but very contemporary. What didn't work for me is the platform beds. boo to Marriott because every other Marriott I've stayed at has incredibly comfortable beds. After 2 back surgeries, it's a high priority for me and I found the platform bed just too hard for me. There is also alot of street noise that kept us awake at night. Service was really so-so. The design is a bit goofy that you have to take 2 separate elevators to get to your room. We've also stayed at the Sofitel which I would rate much higher than this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugLeana
Reviews.Content: We got our reservations though priceline the day of our travel; up to that point we had been unable to get a room for under 250 a night and since we were just going for the weekend, we really didn't want to spend that much. Room rates and priceline approvals vary greatly depending on when you stay. Keep in mind all hotel rooms in NYC are small and these are no doubt small. We wound up with a double bed. (see pics). My husband and I both found the bed to be uncomfortable. It seemed to firm, which normally doesn't bother me but sleeping without a pillow wasn't an option because of it and the two pillows provided weren't much help. One was very stiff and the other sank almost fully to the mattress when you put your head on it. Neither of us slept well the fist night but by the second night we were sleeping much better. The room was very clean, the hotel lobby nice and staff pretty personal. The staff was always smiling and eager to assist. Note that parking is valet and if you have an SUV or truck - you'll be dishing out 10 bucks more a night for parking. Our room was on the 4th floor so our view was excellent but did allow us to watch the snow flurries before they got too close to the ground and became rain or slush. Also, we were high enough that the noise from the busy streets didn't disrupt our sleeping or keep us up. The room was surprisingly quiet with regard to what was going on outside. Our stay here was nice. We'd stay again - in a bigger bed. But overall, great place to sleep after a long day in the city. It's pretty close to everything - at least for us - we walked from 57th all the way to the ferry landing and other parts of the city. Everything is just a number of blocks away and if you aren't into walking the subway is nearby and can get you anywhere you need to be.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: cima2401
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, located in nice area, although not centrally located, everything is walking distance and metro is around the corner. Rooms were small but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Auntbunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight with Marriott points and was treated very well as a Silver Elite member. Packet with the keys included a voucher for a free bar appetizer between 5-10pm. Unfortunately early dinner reservations and a show meant we weren't around to take advantage of the offer. The concierge did make reservations for us and recommended DB Bistro Moderne which was EXCELLENT! I thought it odd that the doorman did not come out to meet cab and stayed in the entrance just hitting the handicap button to open the door. Check in was flawless, the staff friendly and our room was ready at 10:00am! Bellman offered to bring our small bags up to the room but there was no need. The room was small, but clean and with a great view of 57th and Lexington. Unfortunately there was no toilet paper or hair/body products in the bathroom, but the chambermaid was in the hall and this was quickly rectified. The bed and pillows were very comfy! There are 2 Starbucks just right outside and a great place for breakfast just next door. Overall, a great experience and a fun overnight. Would go back again and try out the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Its a good place but not up to Marriott standards`”
Reviews.Author: flyingquant
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if my expectations of this place were too high based on my experience with Marriott and speaking with Marriott's reservations dept. This is advertised as a boutique hotel. I didn't see anything in this place to make it unique from any other hotel I've seen. Oh--actually I'm mistaken. When you enter into the hotel you're not sure if you've actually arrive as the lobby is more of a hall way. The door men hit the button to open the door, which is normally reserved for the disabled. Once you're finished your hallway check in you have to take your bags up one level cross over to the other side and wait for the elevator to take you to your floor. I was disapointed with the room. It was too small. I'm a Marriott silver card holder and the room I had was, in my opinion, inadequate. The decor looked like any other hotel I've been to. The scenery was the side of a semi-derelict building. In order for room service to awaken (at about 9 or 10 AM!), I had to call them 2 or sometimes 3 times asking them where my order was. Now if this place wasn't sold to me as a 5 star location boutique hotel, I would not have expected 5 star service and I would have probably been satisfied with it. However, when a hotel rates them selves so highly and fails to deliver a particular standard, its disapointing. If you're expecting a 2 or 3 start location I'd suggest this place to you as you'll be pleasently surprised. If you're expecting above 4 star, go some where else.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: Gr0undh0g
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a quiet gem! Don't be put off by the"mediocre" reviews posted here. This hotel is very clean, the staff very helpful and friendly ( even let us borrow an umbrella). It has been totally remodeled. The decor is sleek and modern--it has a European feel. Granted, the rooms aren''t the laregest, but they are well designed with built-ins and a frosted glass pocket door for the bathroom. The bar/restaurant was hopping--but upstairs the rooms were quiet with no street noise. The location is great too--walked back from a Broadway show.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: que251
Reviews.Content: What a cute boutique hotel. So intimate and personal. Great location. Service was extremely friendly. It was nice to see the General Manager , John, walking around and talking with the guests. Nice restaurant bar too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Planetisourown
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great spot close to NYC's finest shopping and top attractions like Central Park, Rock Center, Times Square. Service was outstanding. Although we we traveled with a 10 year old I would not recommend this hotel for families. Did not eat at restaurant so no comment.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in Hotel 57”
Reviews.Author: nellukazz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, comfy big beds, big-screened flat TV, and big bathroom!...All good!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: 2Ducky
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and the location convenient. Service was fine, nothing to write home about, though. The hotel is expensive for the price, even by NYC standards.

Reviews.Title: “Chic meets reliable”
Reviews.Author: smallwall
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hidden gem of a hotel. We thought we were staying at a reliable Marriott property, but were very pleasantly surprised when we stumbled upon Hotel 57. It was a quiet sleek hotel with all the comforts of a big hotel. The people who worked there were helpful and kind, the hotel gave off a positive vibe. Opia was the hot spot and and the new loung for hotel guests was perfect. I reccommend this hotel to anyone who's looking for a cooler NYC experience.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room ever”
Reviews.Author: yogiMammothLakes_CA
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past weekend under a group rate and I can only guess they put aside the smallest rooms for this group rate. This was without a doubt the smallest room I have ever seen in a hotel. I also never got the heat to work. The check in was interesting. While waiting my turn to check in, I was number 3 in a line, a woman walked by asking if everybody was being helped. As I was saying no, she continued walking by, never to return. Classic! A positive is the great midtown location. I was on the 12th floor and did not find traffic noise to be an issue. I had a so-so breakfast in the dining room. Ordered an omelet and toast. The toast came dry and I had to flag a server to get butter and jam delivered. Although I understand city center hotels generally have smaller rooms, I will most likely try another hotel in my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Marriott experience we have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: MAvisElaine
Reviews.Content: With the exception of Geoffrey, the concierge, and the doormen, the staff was non existent or totally disinterested. No umbrellas were to be had but we were told to go around the corner to buy a few, the cleaning staff never refilled the coffee maker until collared in the hall. The restaurant provided truly mediocre fare at a lofty price. The location was great, but for $400 a night the service should have been equally good. We've always had good experiences with Marriot Hotels around the world, but this facility clearly defines the nadir for the chain

Reviews.Title: “Not Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mikeucfknights
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Reward Gold members and typically enjoy Renaissance hotels, however this is not your typical Renaissance. Management clearly will tell you that this is hotel is part of a special brand of Renaissance referred to as Boutique. The rediciously small concierge lounge was open to anyone, not that I care but Gold status members and those paying extra for lounge access ultimately are getting ripped off. Not to mention they do not offer an evening buffet of apps, rather you can order off a tapas menu. This hotel is definitely not for young children! We should have figured that out when the stroller barely fit in the elevator and when the 2nd floor lobby had candles lit all over the place, just lying out. Way too posh! This hotel may work for couples or single people but definitely not for those traveling with toddlers/infants. Rooms are tiny, not to mention we had a jr. suite...still too small (guess this is typical for NYC). No bathtub, only glass enclosed shower. No bathroom door, only a pocket door. Way too many breakable items in the room. End tables are top heavy. Not to mention the hazardous wooden platform bed which sticks out horribly. By the time you put your luggage, crib and stroller in the room you have zero room. NYC in general was overwhelming for us. The subway system does not provide elevator options at all the stops...and many restaurants do not have elevators...i.e. TGI Fridays around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother- total disappointment”
Reviews.Author: mary9015
Reviews.Content: My sister and I shared a double room, each on a business trip. The curtains didn't fit the windows and were bunched up blocking the heating system. The light blocker in the window didn't block the light so the lights across the street were also lit up our room. The bathroom had no shelves! Toothbrushes, makeup, etc. all had to be stored on the desk in the room. It is not good for business travelers - only one available outlet at the desk so no computer work while charging a cell phone. The coffee maker was broken - we reported it, however, it wasn't replaced the first day of report. We then left a large note attached to it and that evening there was a new pot - however, because of only one plug at the desk, we made coffee on the floor at the end of the room next to another outlet. We did request a small refrigerator which they did bring up. The iron didn't work. The business center printer was not functional. All this for over $300 a night.. I completed a comment card with my email, phone at work, Marriott reward number (I am a gold level) and now over a month later have never heard a thing from a manager, customer service rep or anyone.

Reviews.Title: “In between 2 brands”
Reviews.Author: cargo13
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Renaissance Hotel 57 is caught between 2 brand images. I was in NYC for a wedding. This hotel was booked by the wedding party but its BAD for elderly visitors. Its trying to be a hip hotel but has the brand of a Renaissance? The lobby area is a waste of space--requires that visitors proceed up an elevator 1 floor, exit and then get on another elevator to go to the rooms. It was very confusing and inefficient. This hotel could learn alot from the San Francisco Marriott Renaissance Park 55 Hotel which does it right. Service was slow. Coincerge pick up of phone calls took after 5 minutes on hold times. The modern fixtures in room are inefficient--hip circular sink design does not drain promptly, its impossible to fill a water bottle from the sink. On the positive side--the coffee self service in room, Aveda products, iHome, and ice machine are nice touches.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jululia
Reviews.Content: Have no 'marriot expectations', I Iike boutique hotels - but something just didn't add up, having stayed in all types of hotels all over the world I felt that the emphasis was not on the guests that were paying to stay there but rather on the parts that cater for the public and that guests have to pay extra for - the bar and restaurant. Therefore the location which is AMAZING and bar were the selling points. Service in general was sloppy - real shame as some people seemed brilliant but were diluted and let down by some completely incompetent. Read on for specific problems with the unit LOCATION: AWESOME, amazing - you are a literal stones throw from bloomingdales for shoppers. You have to travel for most sights - the location is brilliant for those that want to soak up 5th, park and madisson and lexington avenues aswell as central park. BAR: it's a public bar and a brilliant one in it's own right PRICE: what you're really paying for is the location and some snazzy decor because you don't really feel like you're getting what you paid for as the hotel is rather compact...it's hugely overpriced in september! At such high prices you think you wouldn't have to pay for a few minutes on the internet SERVICE: Far from the marriot groups normal service on arrival, my mother and I (2 women) passed 4 bell hop/assistants in the space of about 10 metres - they all asked us how we were but not one offered to helps us through their doors and with our 2 large bits of luggage or to take our luggage to our room - there weren't any other guests so they weren't busy. (I never care about carrying my own luggage but when you pay their september rates of around 700 a night - you would think that you may get some help?) The small lobby is always filled with workers - not that they're actually helpful or do anything most of the time... They have 2 check in desks - there was a bit of a queue at one desk and with other check in assistants hanging around, they still had no urgency to actually do anything. check out bills should not be left outside ones room on the floor for all to see - with personal details on show. Would be helpful if they were more pro active with information, we weren't told anything about anything...specifically about checking out - would be helpful if they told you something about their services or other services available. BEDROOMS really comfy bed - but their doubles are smaller than other hotels 'suites' are not suites, rooms are small - and are badly arranged (can't open wardrobes and stuff properly as it's against the bed nice bathroom BREAKFAST / restaurant although in the hotel/public bar - it's run like a separate restaurant and is pricey nice to sit on the balcony for breakfast - great location looking over 57th The food was nice THE SERVICE WAS THE WORST WE HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED, IN THE WORLD. I am not joking - less than 8 other people in the restaurant we ordered 2 omelettes, we waited well over an hour and 15 mins and went through 3 wrong orders. Eating out all over the world, this is the worst we have ever had. CLEANLINESS seemed clean and new, is easy to make these rooms look/feel clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: GWalkerEdinburgh
